column1: full delivery outside off to start with. Slight wobble in the air. Mayank defends to gully on the front foot
and some shape into the batsman this time, stump to stump line. Agarwal gets behind it and defends
floated up full and wide outside off and Agarwal gets off the mark in style, with a smooth cover drive for four
shortens his length a tad and pulls the line closer to off, and Agarwal defends

oooh there's the Philander skill with subtle movement and putting it in the spot. good length, outside off, and this one nips back in - but fortunately for Agarwal he got a thick inside edge onto pad on his forward defensive
good line and length again, defended into the offside
shaping away at 139 kph, but well outside off and easily left alone
and Rohit gets off the mark as an opener in Test cricket in style, driving on the up through backward point to one that was marginally short and outside off
keeps it well outside off but back of a length rather than short and Rohit lets it go
brings the line closer to off stump, in the channel and on a hard length, Rohit lets it go
extravagant movement away but it's very wide outside off and an easy leave
good length again and in the channel, still getting the movement away, but can be safely left alone
fullish and outside off, lets it go
oooh, he was setting him up for the one that came back in. But Agarwal is equal to it and jabs his bat down, defending from the crease. Ball rolls towards midwicket off a thick inside edge
that is very skilfull from Philander. After nipping one back in, he moves this away and it misses the outside edge by a millimetre. Great line and length, pitches on off and beats bat
fuller, outside off, left alone
back of a length, and Rohit takes a few steps down the track and pats it back to the bowler
ooh another play and miss. Back of a length outside off, again a hint of away movement, Rohit is in two minds almost on whether to play at it or not, pulls his bat back in time
he was taking it away from Rohit, but goes wider of the crease and bowls into Agarwal first up. Defended solidly from the crease
length but well outside off and left alone
digs it in short but that's on the seventh stump line, so it's easy for Agarwal to arch back and let it through
another one that goes past the outside edge, bit of zip from back of a length and moves away from closer to offstump than the previous delivery
play and a miss! Length ball in the corridor that holds its line, and he has a poke at it
on target bouncer, going up to Agarwal's shoulder outside off and he just about manages to defend it down. Not perfectly done, it hung in the air for a bit but dropped well short of Rabada
shape away, but the pace is just 127 kph and it's a bit too full, Rohit mis-times his drive to the bowler
length outside off, lets it go
that's a risky leave! Philander can move it both ways, and this one was coming back in from outside off and Rohit lets it go. It goes just over the stumps
bit of a tentative front-foot defence, not as firm a stride as earlier - perhaps Philander's movement has made him uncertain. Squirts it towards gully
length ball in the channel, this one moves away
and he continues to show his control, nipping this inwards. Rohit lets it go, this is a more comfortable leave with the ball going well over the stumps

length outside off, doesn't rise too much, Agarwal pushes it firmly square by opening the face of the bat. Good timing and it races through point, but the outfield has been pelted by rain so it'll stop before the boundary
back of a length in the channel, stays beside it and punches to point

outside edge flies between third slip and gully!. Can't fault the bowling or the field placing there, three slips and a gully there, but the batsman is fortunate. Was trying to clip that off his hips, it takes the outside edge and flies through
length outside off, defended
zips past the outside edge at 144 kph. Length ball, jags away from off while it's climbing and Agarwal is left feeling for it
and bowls this fuller after having pushed Agarwal on the back foot through the over, but the batsman reads it well and defends on the front foot
steps down the track again and gets it fuller because of that, punches it back to the bowler
stays in his crease this time and there's a solid front foot defence to one outside off
punched through backward point. Back of a length outside off, some width for Rohit and he goes for it, and makes good connection
fuller this time, bit of wobble on the ball, defended on the front foot
keeping it fuller and this time it's coming back in, Rohit goes forward to defend but gets an inside edge onto pad
back of a length and coming back in again, Rohit goes on the back foot to punch but mis-times it as it rolls to the bowler's left. Was a bit surprised by the bounce perhaps
back of a length coming into him, ends up on leg stump and he pushes it down from the crease
back of a length into him and he's late on jabbing the bat down, wears the blow high on the thigh pad
angling into him again but on leg stump, clipped off his hips but straight to short midwicket
fullish on the fifth stump line, comes on the front foot to defend towards point
loud appeal for lbw but they opt not to review. Back of a length, jagging in sharply and he plays down the wrong line to be hit on the thigh pad. Probably too high. Could have missed leg stump too
fullish outside off, left alone
starts off with a full, almost yorker length ball, driven to the bowler's left who fields
inside edge goes through where leg slip might have been. Holds its line after pitching on the stump, Rohit is playing for the turn and gets an inside edge
fuller on the stumps, driven to long-on
full on off, takes a stride out and smothers the spin
very full again, and defended on the front foot again
pulls the length back a tad and gets the ball on middle stump, but a big lunge by Agarwal enables him to effectively smother this one too
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
back of a length on the fourth stump, Rohit stays back and punches to the bowler's left
this one comes back in from back of a length and Rohit is caught in two minds, a bit late to get his bat down and it takes the inside edge and drops down near him
snorter. On target, homing in on his helmet. Rohit goes to pull but then ducks under eventually
length ball nipping in, defended from the crease
fullish on off, gets this to move away after having brought them back in, and the batsman squirts it towards gully
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to drive. Well fielded by mid-off
full outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot

ooh that's past the outside edge. Misread the length completely, was going deep in his crease but this was fuller and Agarwal wasn't in position to play it, ends up jabbing outside off but the ball goes past
this time he does pull his length back but Agarwal steers it away
quicker one outside off
defended solidly on the front foot
fullish outside off in the channel, shoulders arms

pulled with authority. Short ball doesn't really rise up and Rohit goes on the back foot and pulls powerfully from the chest. There is a deep square leg in place who runs to his left to slide and stop the ball
length outside off, straightened a tough, defended towards point on the front foot
good looking straight punch down the ground to a fuller one outside off. Didn't try to hit it too hard
swinging in this time and slightly pulls the length back from a full one, Rohit is still coming on the front foot and gets a bit of an inside edge to midwicket trying to push it
back of a length outside off, lets it go through
fuller, takes a big stride out to push his on-drive
comes on the front foot and works it off his pad to midwicket
tossed up outside off, and Agarwal goes for the full-blooded drive. Silly point cops it on the ankle
he's reaching for the ball a bit, steers it to slip
takes a big stride out while giving himself room, and drives it past mid-on and to the bowler's right. Super timing and it goes all the way
defended on the front foot
length ball pushed to sweeper cover
still getting movement, but this one is well outside off and an easy leave
fullish on the stumps, gets behind it and defends from the crease
lovely shot. Too full outside off and he comes on the front foot to drive pleasingly through cover.
pulls his length back slightly and gets a bit of away movement, Agarwal defends on the front foot towards point
length outside off, patted towards point
tossed up outside off, very full, pushed gently into cover for a single. Played with soft hands
quicker one outside off, Agarwal stays deep in his crease and jabs it away towards point
slightly shorter and still wide of off, allows him to go back and cut to third man
fullish, defended along the ground to short cover's left
fullish, tossed up, pushed gently to cover
short and outside off, he rocks back and unleashes a fierce cut but straight to point
length and just outside off, opens the face and chops to gully
length ball and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, an anxious jab on the rise, but he gets it out to sweeper cover
length and slanted into off stump. Defended down the pitch
length and into the pads. Allows that to come on and nudges to fine leg
full and just outside off, opens the face and slices on the up to sweeper cover
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to short leg off the back foot
length outside off, reaches out and defends to backward point
short of a length and in at off stump, punched to short extra cover off the back foot

not in control but hit hard enough nonetheless to get to the point boundary. Length ball dipping wide outside off. He reaches out a long way with his hands. Not to the pitch of this and throws his hands to chop it away. Probably only safe to do that in the first session of this match. It was aerial
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper cover
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
short outside off, rolls the wrists to cut along the floor to the sweeper
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, looks to drive on the up, gets it off the inside half to mid-on
length and turning in at middle stump. Defended from deep in the crease
tossed up on middle stump, flicked firmly on the bounce to short midwicket
full outside off, leans in and drives against the turn to mid-off
short of a length and turning in from wide outside off, shuffles and defends hurriedly on the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed to short leg with the turn
short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot

here we go. It was a matter of time before he took on the spinners. This is pushed through at a length on middle stump. He's down the track quickly and lofts it languidly over the long-on boundary to bring up fifty for the opening stand
length on off stump, stabbed past the bowler off the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, driven with the turn, but can't beat a tumbling Bavuma at short extra
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length outside off, pushed through cover on the front foot
full and flat outside off, whipped on the full down to long-on
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
full outside off, hangs the bat inside the line after getting forward. Thick outside edge dribbles wide of slip
short of a length and turning in sharply. Tapped to mid-off off the inside half of the bat
oh nicely steered past slip. Short of a length and sliding through at a convenient pace. Waits for it on the back foot and stabs it late, off the face of the bat, to find the third man boundary
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
length on middle stump, onto the back foot as he punches to mid-on
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
full outside off, defended to short cover
past the outside edge. Short of a length and some turn away outside off. Cuts from underneath this
full and flat on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to short mid-on
length on leg stump, tucked to square leg's right off the front foot

clears the straight boundary! Not off the middle of the bat, it appears. Length ball on middle stump, steps out to meet this and is cramped a touch, but he uses a short-arm drive to lift it over the non-striker. Slightly off the inside half, the bat turning in hands at the end
length at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
full outside off, defended on the front foot to cover
length outside off, driven on the rise to short cover

slapped to the point boundary! The cameras show Faf wiping his face with a towel. It's slowly getting to that kind of a day on evidence of the last 15 minutes. Short and into the corridor. Lots of pace on that and he uses it nicely
length outside off, tapped into the covers
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
lbw shout as Rohit is trapped in front of leg playing the sweep. That pitched outside leg
launched over long-on! There's risk in that because he hasn't got to the pitch of this length ball on middle stump. But he goes through and cracks it on the rise, and far far over the fielder
length at leg stump, clipped into the leg side
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
full and into leg stump. Flicked to midwicket
full and in at the stumps. Solidly blocked on the front foot
full and in at off stump. Squeezed out to mid-off on the front foot
short of a length outside off, poked into the off side off the back foot
length outside off, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, defended to point
full on off stump, jammed back down the pitch
length on middle stump, steps out and taps it to mid-on
length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
shot! Superb. This is flighted up outside off. He steps out and flicks the wrists firmly to get this wide of mid-on, all along the floor
full outside off, caressed to sweeper cover off the front foot
length outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, defended to backward point off the back foot
length on off stump, defended to cover off the back foot
length and in at the stumps. Defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked between the two midwicket fielders
short of a length outside off, punched on the up extra cover
length on middle stump, driven on the up to mid-on
full toss on middle stump, driven to long-on
length outside off, blocked into the covers
full outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
beaten in flight but that skids straight o and he can defend it. Length on off and some bounce. Gets it off the right thumb
length and in at leg stump. Flicked to square leg

top edge just past backward square! Brings up fifty and is true to his Test reputation as he gets it. Length ball on leg stump. Gets down for the lap sweep, but his head is not moving into this shot with his stride. The result is the extra bounce gets the top edge. The fielder leaps to his right and backwards, but can't hold on to this. Streaky, but it's been a deserved fifty
length and in at off stump, blocked off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
short outside off, arches into the leg side to let that go
length and in at the stumps. Defended into the leg side from deep in the crease
length ball at off stump, defended watchfully into the off side
length outside off, nice stride forward to defend. Still no great turn for Maharaj
drags it too short and it sits up outside off, and Rohit transfers weight back and punches from the stumps with elegance, sending it screaming to the cover boundary
fuller on off, defended
tossed up, drifting on leg, he makes a bit of room and pats it down the ground to long-on
given some air outside off, blocked on the front foot
strays on leg stump again, worked to short fine leg from the front foot
back of a length around off, punched on the up to extra cover
fullish on off, inviting the drive. Rohit does exactly that, but straight to short cover
nipping in slightly from back of a length, tucked to midwicket from the crease
too short outside off, and he plays a short arm cut through backward point
length, well outside off, he wanted to dab it past gully but ends up just under-edging it
fuller, angling into him, defended back
given some air outside off, he comes on the front foot and pushes it into the offside
skips down the track and almost gets to the pitch of the ball, taps it to mid-on
flighted on the stumps, he gets beside the ball and defends solidly with a big stride out
down the track again, pushed back to the bowler
Maharaj is angling it into Rohit who is countering with a slight movement almost as if making room - when he's not running down the track - and he does that again to punch it back
skips down the track again and pats it back to the bowler
length ball in the channel, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length outside off, steered to point
back of a length, coming in, tucked to backward square leg. They debate a single but decide to play safe and stay in their respective ends
back of a length outside off, short enough for him to make some room and slash it hard, but backward point fields
length outside off, defended solidly
back of a length on off, dabs it to backward point
full on off, pushed gently on the front foot towards the bowler's left

was caught in two minds there, with one that gripped and turned more than the others. Went on the back foot, expecting to get it nearer his pads but it broke sharply and bounced and he ends up jabbing it down away from body
bit of extra bounce again but he manages to keep it down
nice loop, he's down the track but it dips on him but he plays it back defensively with a straight bat
flighted on the stumps, pushed towards extra cover
flighted on the stumps, big stride forward to smother the ball
length outside off, mis-times his drive to cover

back of a length and that's come back in, and struck a painful blow on the knee to Agarwal. went off his inside edge actually. He was pushing at it, takes the edge and hits him inside the pad, with his knee bent
too full on the pads and Agarwal gets over it and flicks through midwicket with lovely timing and wrists. Raises the 100-run stand
length outside off, defended carefully towards point
fulller length, stump to stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, seemed to hold on the pitch a little, he drives fluently enough but straight to cover
length outside off, defended towards point
tossed up, he comes on the front foot and is solid in defence
down the track, the bowler adjusts and drags it short, but Rohit manages to slap this to long-on from close to his body

inside out and slam. What a way to raise his fifty! Flighted outside off, he makes room and drives powerfully, doesn't bother keeping it down and doesn't need to because it carries all the way over extra cover
length outside off, comes on the front foot to defend it safely
fuller on the stumps, blocked on the front foot
loud shout for lbw, but they decide not to review. Jagging back in on a length and he has Rohit playing down the wrong line, struck on the front pad, but that was missing leg comfortably
length outside off, steered to a square third man
fuller outside off, solid in in his front foot defence is Rohit
that's been steered between first slip and gully. He was opening the face of the bat but probably didn't intend to send it exactly there, takes a half edge, half steer and goes to the boundary
fuller on the stumps, gets behind it and defends solidly
flatter into the stumps, he goes back and slaps this to long-on with a horizontal bat
Rohit's playing Maharaj much more carefully than Agarwal. Front foot defence again
given some air on the stumps, comes on the front foot to defend
and there's the release shot, dancing down the track, but the bowler saw him and pushed it wider. Slow enough for Rohit to adjust and flay this through cover
fuller on off, defended on the front foot
tossed up, draws him into a big lunge to defend, squirts it towards gully
sumptuous Short ball outside off, he rocks back and punches on the up, through point
back of a length outside off, he moves slightly across and flicks to midwicket
short ball, doesn't rise too high, Rohit swivels and pulls from near his midriff. Deep square leg in place though, so only a single
hangs on the back foot to this back of a length ball outside off and jabs it towards point
full on middle stump, pushed to mid-on with a straight bat
length angling in on off, defended from the crease on the back foot
coming down the track and Maharaj flights it wide of the stumps, Rohit adjust and goes close to the ball to defend
those trips down the track have made Maharaj bowl one a bit shorter, and this time Rohit is waiting in his crease, punches off the back foot through cover
tossed up on middle, defended with a big stride
gets some bounce on that from a length, Agarwal stays back and pats it down towards gully
makes a bit of room to drive this fuller one to long-off
good length, he lunges forward and defends into the offside
fuller length around off, comes on the front foot and reaches for the ball with his hands to push it to mid-off
back of a length in the channel, he thinks about playing a shot but pulls his bat out of the way in time
strays on the pads and is turned to fine leg
length outside off, pushed gently between point and cover. Played softly enough that they can take a quick single
bouncer, good surprise ball but a bit too short and relatively easy to duck under for the batsman
length on the stumps, defends by getting well behind it
stays in his crease to a fullish one and manages to defend it into the offside
short and wide outside off, slashes it to deep point
fuller, defended on the front foot
full outside off, comes on the front foot to defend
Maharaj is sticking to the length that demands batsmen to get a nice stride out but they're negotiating that comfortably - helps that there's not much turn
driven to extra cover
ah, there's the Rohit special. Pull shot in front of square. Comes on the front foot to a short of length ball outside off and meets the ball in front of his eyes. Imperious
length outside off, pushed to cover
another short ball, this one rising a bit higher so Rohit goes back and across and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, dab-steered to third man
full, almost yorker length but not quite, nudged to midwicket
flicked off the pads languidly to deep midwicket
fuller defended
very full, but he's opted not to get a big sride out this time and defends it from the crease
clipped to long-on
angling into him slightly round arm, he stays well back and blocks it in front of his pads
given room outside off, and he cuts to deep point
stopped a mite on the pitch and Rohit pushed at it while playing the forward defense. Hangs for a moment extra in the air but still well in front of short mid-off
flighted outside off, pushed to extra cover
down the track and almost yorks himself, but he has the room to stroke it through point
nice flight outside off on a length, he comes on the front foot and defends
too full on off, gently clipped through midwicket, good timing
flatter, goes right back and defends it in front of his pads
length outside off, gets some turn into the right-hander, who goes back and across to clip to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra
length on off stump, defended into the covers
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
full ball tossed up outside off, drilled firmly to extra cover's left and he fumbles to allow a run
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
slammed past the non-striker. Length on middle stump, steps out and gets to the pitch to hit this about waist height to beat long-on to the left
length on leg stump, defended to square leg
short of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
dragged to the square leg boundary. Piedt is still struggling for rhythm. Drops it short on the hips. No one deep over there and it's an easy put away
full on middle stump, leans in and drives with the turn to long-on
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended into the pitch via the pad
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, mistimed drive to cover
drifted in full on middle stump, defended into the off side
length on off stump, defended to silly point

short of a length just outside off. Chopped to backward point's left. And a brief mix-up. Mayank sets off for the run immediately and gets sent back. He goes back. Rohit then changes his mind and sets off for the run, but is stopped by Mayank. The fielder slides to his left to stop in the meantime
length on off stump, defended on the off side
length outside off, dead-batted on the off side
length on off stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket's left. Diving stop there

carted over the midwicket boundary! That's disdainful. It's the second time he's come down to Piedt, not made the pitch, and still managed to slog through the line. This one sits up on middle stump and he sends it sailing

over long-on this time! Rohit doesn't rate offspinners like many of his peers. Meets this length ball on the full at a middle stump line and gently lofts this over the fielder in the deep with the full face offered
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
length at off stump, defended into the covers
length on off stump, defended into the off side
arm ball has him hurriedly defending from deep in the crease
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
full on off stump, defended into the off side
length at off stump, driven past the bowler to long-off. A touch from the catching mid-off fielder
lovely flow of the hands. Lobbed right up outside off and he leans in and gets his weight into this drive, bisecting short extra cover and cover expertly
length and in at leg stump. Gets forward to flick and cops that on the front pad
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
inside edge trickles past deep backward square. Length ball comes in from outside off as he has a chop away from the body. Nutmegs himself
length on off stump, defended down the pitch
length on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
length outside off, driven to sweeper cover on the front foot
too easy. Short and wide, sitting up - do whatever you want. Rohit carves it past backward point
length on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
chucks it back at the keeper after fielding it. Length outside off, steps out and gets a leading edge to roll down the pitch
length outside off, chopped to backward point
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
neatly driven to long-on. Length on middle stump, big stride and driven with the angle
short of a length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and tucks this wide of midwicket with soft hands
length with some drift in at off stump. Defended into the off side on the front foot
short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Tapped to short extra

there it is! Off comes the helmet. Raises the bat. He's just parted Indian fans into two halves like Moses parted the sea - one side his staunchest supporters, the other skeptics. But it's an impressive innings from an impressive player. Chops a short ball to sweeper cover and responds to the standing ovation from a delighted dressing room
length and down leg side. Left alone
past the outside edge. Length ball dips into him, draws him forward and jumps past the edge
full on off stump, defended into the leg side
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
past the edge again. Length outside off and more grip for Maharaj to go past the forward defence
length outside off, sliced to backward point off the back foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball at leg stump, offers the pad
full outside off, meets it at the pitch and drills it to long-off's left
short ball on leg stump, pulled to deep backward square
full on leg stump, defended down the pitch
length on leg stump, defended to midwicket
length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
full and floated into leg stump. Leans in to drive to long-on
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
swiped over the square leg boundary. No one in the deep. Length ball on middle stump, gets low and one again doesn't control the sweep fully. But it's a safe option
short of a length on off stump, bunted down the pitch off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and into the stumps. Driven past the non-striker
length on middle stump, flicked to mid-on off the back foot
length and mild wobble at an off stump line. Drives on the up to mid-on
Markram evades that at gully. Looks like he didn't pick it. Short ball just outside off. Slashes at it with an open face and it flies over Markram's shoulder as he goes to the floor
full and just outside off, driven to extra cover

oh gorgeous. Length ball outside off, stays rooted to the crease and just drives through the line with perfect timing. Also opens his wrists late when he makes connection, so he can get this between extra cover and sweeper cover. Pure class
caressed wide of backward point. Watched that so closely. Short of a length ball skidding into the corridor. Made sure to stay on top of that and just use the face to run it past the fielder
length on off stump, defended to silly point on the front foot
full on off stump, defended back to the bowler
full and flat at off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right

just past silly point! That's the shot they've been setting him up for - hard hands as he pushes outside off. It's in the air momentarily but silly point has already gotten pretty upright. it dips quickly to his right though, so not realistically a catching chance
length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
length ball slanted in at middle stump. Half a step across and pushed into the leg side
early work for Maharaj and he can't drag this in at fine leg. A length ball onto his pads. Allows that to come on and tickles it fine. Maharaj had a lot of running to do to his right
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover's left
past the inside edge as he looks to drive on the up and away from the body. Length ball outside off, skids on low and he hasn't put in a stride to try and get behind this
length outside off and cutting away, left alone
full on off stump, good stride out to meet the ball and he drives along the floor to long-off
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length on off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
length on off stump, defended as this skids on with the arm
inside edge onto pad but no one to catch that on the leg side. Length ball skidding on again and he gets forward to have a stab at it
chopped past gully! It's a feature of Mayank's batting to stay leg side and use quick wrists outside off. Short of a length and a lot of width from Philander and Mayank springs out at it
skids on low as he goes back to a length ball. It's at the stumps too. Just manages to get the inside part of the toe-end on this
length and in at the stumps again, half stride forward this time to defend
length outside off, gets nicely forward, jabs it wide of extra cover and gets into the nineties
slight swing inwards at a length on off stump. Driven on the up to mid-off
overpitched outside off, reaches out and drives to sweeper cover
aerial but well short of extra cover. Length ball outside off and he has a slap at this
length at the stumps, tapped back on the front foot
length at the stumps, steps out and pushes down the pitch
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, soft-handed block on the front foot
full on leg stump, leans in and flicks down to long-on
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side off the inside half

clipped over midwikcet and it trickles into the boundary. Don't think that came off the middle. The bat turned in his hands. But the intent was to get it over the infield, and he succeeded with a flick. Length ball on the pads and he put it away the way he wanted to

dropped. De Kock can't wrap the gloves around this outside edge. He's up to the stumps, remember. Rohit has been antsy all morning, and he's given the chance. Length ball outside off, reaches out away from the body on the front foot and gets a thin outside edge. It gets the outside part of QDK's glove and rolls to gully's left
length on off stump, tapped down the pitch
length and in at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
well controlled. Short of a length and angled into the corridor. Creates some room for his arms and caresses this past backward point on the back foot
short of a length outside off, on the back foot to punch to sweeper cover
short of a length and skidding low outside off. Watches that closely, gets low and chops to short third man
length ball tossed up outside off, left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
lobbed up full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and curving in at off stump. Solidly defended on the front foot
length outside off, has a jab at it with gap between bat and front pad
length and in at off stump, allows that to come in and opens the face late to get the single at deep point
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
in the air as he tries to take the bottom hand off this. Length ball in at leg stump, poked towards mid-on on the up

big dive at the non-striker's end as the throw comes in from deep point. Short and wide outside off, cut to short third's right. He dives and parries it to sweeper cover who runs in and catches Rohit ambling back to the other end. But the throw is wide and he survives as a result
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended into the off side
full on off stump, jammed to short extra
length on leg stump, defended off the inside half
no stopping this. Short of a length outside off, waits on it and gently nudges it to short third man's left
nicely driven, but straight to mid-off. Length on off stump, punched on the rise
full slower ball outside off, driven out to sweeper cover
length outside off, gets forward and slices to deep point to get to 99
length on off stump, solidly defended down the pitch
length on off stump, defended on the back foot. Nicely behind the line of that
misfield. And one turns to four. Muthusamy with the shocker at midwicket. Length ball on middle and leg, flicked to his right. He slides and lets that go straight through
sent back! Length ball outside off, drives to short extra cover. There's a fumble there and Mayank wants to steal the run, but he's sent back

gets it! Thousands of runs to break the door down, did what was asked on away tours, and Mayank comes home for a maiden Test hundred. He's been patient and cut down on his strokeplay. Gets to the ton with a big stride forward and a push to short third man's left
length outside off, tapped to extra cover's left
length outside off, pushed into the covers
short of a length outside off, under-edge on the attempted cut
length outside off, blocked to short extra's  left
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
length on middle stump, flicked into the leg side
short of a length outside off, chopped to gully on the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper on the rise
withdraws the bat as this short ball gets steep outside off. Lets that go. It was wide enough that he could
short outside off, gets leg side of it and steers to deep point
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended into the covers
full outside off, gets forward to defend, gets it off the inside edge to midwicket's right
length and skidding straight on. Left alone with off stump exposed. Looks like he expected that to turn
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
punched wide of sweeper cover. Length ball on off, onto the back foot quickly and supremely timed back foot drive. Nice work too in the outfield, a slide to the right
short ball rising up outside off, left alone
pokes away from the body as this cuts away from a length outside off. Assuredly a risky shot anywhere else in the world. Here it's an easy two to deep point's left
short and up at the hips. Solidly defended on the back foot
short outside off, on his toes to push this to cover's left
length and in at middle stump. Defended to square leg off the inside half
overpitched outside off, driven to extra cover on the front foot
full on off stump, defended into the covers
full and into the legs. Gets forward and flicks through square leg
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
drilled over the bowler. Looks so so good. Whew. Length ball drifted it in at middle stump. Gets to the pitch with a hop down and a nice flow of the arms
steered to the square leg boundary. Length ball lobbed up wide outside off. Gets down and sweeps aerially, but intentionally. The field has been in all Test long on that side for Rohit
full outside leg stump, offers the pad
flat length ball on middle stump. Steps out, doesn't get to the pitch, but drives through the line as this doesn't turn. To long-off's right and he has to lunge and stop
full outside leg, kicked away
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, clipped through the leg side off the back foot
full on leg stump, a hurried sweep out to deep backward square
short ball on leg stump. Gets back to pull, gets an inside edge onto thigh pad and to short fine's left
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket on the front foot
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket's right
full outside off, plants the leg out at it. It trickles into the fine leg boundary
length outside leg, kicked into the leg side
short, on the pads, and he swivels this away towards deep backward square leg. And then soaks in the applause for reaching his 150!
down the leg side, and misses his pads as he looks to glance
pulls out the reverse sweep. and controls it beautifully! Was tossed up outside leg, and he waited till the end before guiding it over to the third man boundary
tucks a fuller ball away towards long leg
flighted, and he drives it back, and the bowler dives to his left to stop this
reverse from Rohit this time. Played much more square, as he meets this earlier. Placed to perfection, where point might have been...but wasn't!
goes back to defend this
comes down the wicket, and meets it on the half volley. Smashes this high, wide and handsome over midwicket!
tossed up, and he drives this back to the right of Piedt, who dives to stop this
fuller, and he plays a fine lap sweep. Only in reverse! Top batting. The slip had been moved out, and he just manipulates that change to his advantage. That has also got rid of the forward short leg
full, on the pads, and he drops it with soft hands towards square leg. Easy single on offer, and they take it
fuller, on the pads, and he plays this towards square leg
pitched outside off, good length, and he drops it towards point and calls his partner through for a quick single
defends a length ball outside off
goes down to a full ball down the pads, and paddles this through towards fine leg. Top shot
defends a length ball tossed up on off stump
length ball, defends it around off stump
drives on the up, but it lands just short of cover
full ball, around off, and he drives this towards long off
flatter, down the leg side, and he goes down on one knee, and maneouvres this down towards fine leg with a slight touch. Smart batting again!
tossed up around leg, and he defends
slow, loopy ball around leg stump, and that allows Rohit enough time to rock back and get this past Dean Elgar at square leg. A dive, but futile
fuller, and he drives towards midwicket
driven towards midwicket
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend
good ball, precise in length, and turns away from him after pitching on leg. He is solidly behind the line
tossed up around off, and he drives this with a lot of wristwork. Cannot beat cover, though
full, draws him forward, and he presses ahead to defend
tossed up, and he drives this down towards long off
flighted, and he drives this towards midwicket
down the leg side, and Mayank Agarwal throws his bat at it. Cannot get to it, and it is called a wide
tossed up around the pads, and he plays it away towards midwicket
flighted around leg stump, and he plays what can only be described as a reverse flick! Stays upright, and plays it away to point.
flicked away towards fine leg
tossed up around off, and Agarwal has to send Rohit back. Was looking to get across to the other side, but du Plessis was quick to go acrosss from slip towards point
tossed up around leg, and he plays this beautifully past midwicket, down towards a deeper midwicket position. Wide mid on has to go around to his right to field this
moves across to beyond the leg stump to meet a ball pitched outside leg, but can only guide it with the turn towards cover
flighted around off, and he plays it with soft hands to the right of cover
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward to a length ball. It dips on him, but he defends it right under his eyes
chances his arm with a ball looped around off stump. Has sliced this a bit, but gets enough to clear Vernon Philander at a wide long off position
inside out this time, and well clear of Philander. Good length, but he took half a step to get closer to it and eliminate any chance

and they've finally got the wicket! Tossed up by Maharaj, and Rohit looks to come forward to drive, and is beaten by the turn and the flight. Well done by de Kock to dislodge the bails, and Rohit walks off to some congratulatory handshakes from the opposition team. What a start to the story of Rohit Sharma, the Test opener!
tossed up, and he plays it towards point. Pujara sets off for a single, and is sent back. Has to scurry back!
tossed up around off, and he plays it with soft hands towards point
flatter, quicker from wide of the crease from Muthusamy, and Agarwal goes back to defend
presses forward to defend this around off
tossed up, and he presses forward to defend. Doesn't turn at all, and gets him on the lower glove. Jars his hands a bit
tossed up outside off, and he presses forward but offers a dead bat to defend this
flighted, around off, and he drives this hard, and through the gap between cover and silly mid off
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
goes back and guides a length ball around off, fired in a bit quicker, towards point
fires this down the leg side, and it's an easy put away towards fine leg. Gets two for it
flights it around off, and he presses forward to defend
length, outside off, and he leaves this
fuller, around leg stump, and he plays it away towards midwicket
fuller ball, a hint of shape away, as Agarwal stretches forward to drive this towards cover
swings away from outside off, and he shoulders arms
swings away outside off, and he leaves. Low bounce on this one, as de Kock collects it low down by the ground
angles down the leg side, as it strikes Agarwal on his pads as he shapes to flick a fuller ball
away swing, outside off, and left alone. A similar pattern to most of this Philander over
loosener, outside off, and Pujara can leave this alone. A hint of outswing for Rabada as well
fuller, straighter, and Pujara presses forward to defend this as it angles back into him
starts from outside off, and keeps swinging further away. De Kock has to collect this in front of first slip

fuller, straighter, and he drives this ramrod-straight back towards the bowler. Misses Rabada, and then goes on to hit the stumps. Pujara is annoyed with himself, as he nearly got that through for runs. Possibly four!
leaves a length ball, lifting and seaming away from him outside off
length, angles back into him, and he defends this from the crease
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend this
length, outside off, and he presses forward to guide this to the right of point. There's enough time for them to scuttle through for the first run off the second new ball
decent movement away from the bat! Must have nipped off the seam, pitching around off stump. Pujara was thinking about having a poke at it, but withdrew his bat late
length, outside off, and he shoulders arms to this again
length, angles into him, and he plays it away towards square leg
fuller, draws Pujara forward, and beats his outside edge as it shapes away off the seam
length, and he plays it away towards midwicket
angles in towards him, and he comes forward to play it. Off the edge, towards second slip, but well short of him
shorter ball, and he ducks inside the line of this
shorter, slightly wider, and he looks to guide this past the gully region, but cannot beat the fielder there. Diving away to his left, keeps them from picking up runs
fuller, straighter, and he plays it back towards the bowler
length, angles into him at 136kph, and he defends

wow! What a delivery! The perfect outwsinger. Length ball curving away slightly from middle stump. Pujara defends for the line with an angled bat, and the ball is past the outside edge to knock off stump
length ball just outside off, leans in and defends solidly to cover
length and some shape away in the corridor. Behind the line to defend this
length outside off, big stride forward to drive on the up to mid-off
length and just outside off. Defended on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, stabbed to point off the back foot
length and in at the stumps. Flicked uppishly to midwicket
length on leg stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
length and in at leg stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
length on off stump, defended
length and in at middle, defended down the pitch
gets it past mid-off. Full outside off, waits on this late and punches firmly, although slightly off the outside half of the bat
shot. Full ball just outside off. No movement on it this time and he gets a nice stride forward, full face of the bat and drills it between bowler and mid-off
length ball just outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
jags away off the pitch and he's slightly squared at this. Length ball moving away from off stump. Defended on the back foot
length on off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
length outside off, drops it into the off side with soft hands, sent back as he thinks of a run
length outside off, opens the face and defends to point
length and just outside off, defended into the covers
length and in at off stump. Opens the face and defends from deep in the crease
inside edge as this jumps back in from outside off. Angled bat defence from Mayank. Looked like he was shaping to block that outside off
length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
whack. Short ball outside off, doesn't quite climb up. Kohli shuffles, swivels, and pummels this with a hook in front of square
length on off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
length outside off, looks to defend away from the body and gets it off the inside edge
length outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, tapped to deep point on the front foot
length ball shaping away late outside off. Forces him to reach out and then check his cover drive
length outside off, leans in and drives to extra cover
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, crisply driven to long-off's left
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
length on off stump, jumps up and turns away to catch the high part of the bat
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
length outside off, leans in and pushes to deep point
length just outside off, defended into the covers
length outside off, dabs it to point with soft hands
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
length on middle stump, flicked to mid-on with the angle
past mid-on this time! Full on leg stump this time, it's drive-able. And he uses the angle to drive it to that fielder's right
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, steps out and drives firmly to extra cover
length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, looks to drive through the line well away from the body. Gets it off the inside half to mid-off
nicely done! And that is 150 for him. Short of a length delivery into the hips. Stays on his feet, nice and tall, and tucks this to the fine leg boundary
length outside off, defended into the covers

length outside off, defended into the covers

full and drifted in at middle stump. Dead-batted on the front foot
beaten on the outside edge. Length ball skidding into the corridor. He drives from inside the line
length on off stump, defended to silly point
big lbw appeal but the foot was well outside off stump. Length ball and he was looking to paddle this fine
length outside off, pushed to cover's left
short of a length outside off, defended into the off side off the back foot
length outside off, whipped to sweeper's right
length outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length outside off, gets well forward and defends to gully
inside edge onto pad, bobs up into the leg side but safely in front of midwicket. Length ball in the corridor, looked to defend away from the body
length on off stump, flicked to midwicket with the angle in
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
oh lovely placement. Length ball outside off, gets forward and low and just laps this fine
short of a length just outside off, chopped to short third man
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball just outside off, pulled firmly into the turf, can't beat midwicket to his left
length on off stump, deep in the crease to clip this to midwicket
length and just outside off, defended into the off side on the front foot
length outside off, jabbed on the up to mid-off
boom. Overpitched outside off and he just springs at this - big stride, carved wide of extra cover
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left
length on middle, on the back foot to whip this to long-on
full outside off, scythed to sweeper cover
full on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
inside-out glory. That is stylish from Mayank. Full ball on middle and off, gets to the pitch and launches this wide of long-off
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to short third
pumped over the sightscreen! Full ball on middle stump, gets the front leg out of the way and hits this cleanly and very very straight
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half
length on off stump, driven to extra cover

leading edge and taken! Senuran Muthusamy's first Test wicket is Virat Kohli. Length ball on middle stump, turning away. A lazy shot from Kohli, really. In front of his body and flicking against the turn without getting in line. It's a gentle, friendly lob back to the bowler who grabs on to his left and will no doubt never shut up about this! And why should he?
length outside off, defended on the front foot
inside edge onto toe. Short of a length outside off. Looked to defend on the back foot
nearly trapped on the back foot as this length ball skids on low. He's very close to being trapped on the back leg but the inside edge gets in the way
nice and confident this time. Short and wide outside off, quickly back and across and chopped to the point boundary
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up wide outside off, driven along the floor to sweeper cover
length just outside off, gets deep in the crease and pushes to extra cover's left
full outside off, gets down and laps this towards the long leg boundary. Slip has to give chase to pull that back in
full toss on leg stump, looks to drive but that comes off the toe-end
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump. Defended off the back foot

short outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length on off stump, defended with soft hands
length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, whipped to square leg. Mix-up results in a hurried throw, which results in an overthrow at sweeper cover
drags it a little short and wide, and he goes back and punches this towards deep point
length, driven back to the bowler

down the wicket, and clears cover as he goes inside out! Turns it into a virtual half-volley and then does enough to clear Bavuma, who dives across it like a goalkeeper, but cannot get his fingertips to it
defended towards point
presses forward to defend a length ball towards wide cover. Wants a single, but turned down by Rahane
presses down to push a length ball towards mid off
goes back to a flatter ball, a bit of turn as it straightens into him, but he can negotiate it as he plays late
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward to defend a length ball
good ball! Length, and it bounces a bit extra as it turns and straightens. Rahane goes back and plays it cautiously, with a dead bat
presses forward to defend a length ball
short, and he goes back and flogs this to the vacant deep midwicket region. Really poor ball, considering a majority of his field is along the off side
slower through the air, outside off, and he tries to steer it towards deep point. Off the inside edge as it drops near his bat, on the bounce towards first slip
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
tossed up outside off, has a good go at it, driving it with his wrists, but cannot beat cover
defended off a good length around off stump
allows the ball to turn across him, and then nudges it away towards deep point
presses forward to defend a length ball at off stump
sashays down the wicket, and lofts this over long off. And it has gone a long, long way! What a way to enter his 190s!
length, and he drives it back down the pitch
angles into him, and he presses forward to defend. Off the inner edge, but falls towards short leg along the ground
goes back to one that turns away from him, and plays it away towards deep point
length, and he goes back to defend towards cover. Wanted a single, but a loud refusal from Agarwal persuades him otherwise
length, angles into him, and he plays it away with an open face of the bat towards deep point
length, and he presses forward and nurdles it away towards point
slow turn, from around the wicket, and Rahane leaves as it pitches outside off
presses forward to defend a length ball tossed up around off
opens the face of his bat to steer a length ball towards point
length, at the stumps, and he goes back to defend this
Agarwal gets down on his haunches and whips this away, but cannot place it beyond square leg
a near-replay of the previous ball, as Agarwal fetches this from outside off, and gets it away towards deep square leg
defends a length ball, delivered on leg stump from around the wicket
presses forward to smother a ball angled across him

short, and he bends to maneouvre this away. <b>Tries to clear square leg, but doesn't get it off the middle<b/>. Thankfully so, as it lands on one bounce and reaches the fielder there anyway. Enough time to go through for the single
short, and he goes back and punches this towards deep backward point
length, and he goes back to punch this towards cover
flighted, and he looks to flick this away. Some turn, and it goes off the leading edge, but along the ground, towards point
defends a length ball towards cover
defends a length ball, angling into him, from the crease
presses forward to defend a length ball
fuller, on leg stump, and he tries to sweep this fine, but cannot beat short fine leg
flighted around leg, and he glances, but cannot beat the man at short fine leg
angles across Agarwal from around the stumps, and he presses forward to defend this
length, angles across him, but gives him enough time to go back and flick this away towards midwicket

that has kept low! A regular length ball, outside off, and dies on Rahane as it comes through. He goes back and plays it cautiously towards point. Well controlled in the end, but that pitch behaviour will enthuse the Indian spinners
goes back to defend a length ball around off stump

Agarwal has brought up his double hundred! Tossed up by Maharaj outside off, and he drives firmly down towards long off. There was some work for the fielder to do and he knew immediately that he would get two. Raises his arms as he comes through for the second, and now soaks in the applause of the crowd, and his teammate. What a good knock this has been!
slightly short in length, and gives him time to play it away towards point
defended towards midwicket
flighted around leg stump, and he can press forward, play this around his feet and get it away to the left of square leg
bowled from wider of the crease, fires it in at the stumps, and he plays it with a dead bat towards covers

advances down the track, and Maharaj shortens his length in response. Agarwal then waits on it, and plays it late towards backward point. That has been a recurrent theme of his batting here -- just how late he meets the ball
comes forward and takes this on the full, and flogs this over midwicket! Is he going to go for quick runs now?
fired down the leg side, and he misses out on a thwack towards long leg
plays a length ball towards midwicket, and sets off for what looks like a tough single. They are quick between the stumps, these two, though!
full ball, outside off, and he defends with a dead bat
uses his feet to skip to the pitch of this, and gets it through covers and along the ground, Most importantly, through the gap
leaves a length ball outside off
presses forward to defend a length ball
eases a length ball outside off, plays it towards point with an open face of his bat
defends a length ball around off stump
goes back and punches a length ball towards cover
defends a length ball towards cover

Maharaj gets his man! He looped this up outside off stump, and just held the length back a touch. Rahane uses his feet, but cannot commit himself too far forward, probably conscious of the man under the helmet on the off side, and ends up skewing a drive uppishly towards cover, where Bavuma takes a comfortable catch for his standards. Good captaincy, and top bowling from Maharaj, who has easily been the pick of the spinners, despite having taken a fair amount of stick
fuller, on the pads, and he plays it away towards long leg
goes back to cut a shorter ball, but cannot beat point
fuller, and he presses forward to defend
lets a length ball outside off, turning further away, pass through
defends a length ball fired in around off stump
length, straightens after pitching around middle and off, and he presses forward to defend
wide, and short, and keeps low. Agarwal tries to cut this away, but it goes low and takes the under edge towards first slip
flighted around off, and he drives but cannot beat cover
flighted again, but this time he is prepared for it. Stretches to take it on the full, and then strikes it gorgeously through covers

a slog goes straight towards deep midwicket, and the catch is completed! Handshakes all around from the South African camp as Agarwal walks off after a top innings. Tossed up closer to the stumps, and Mayank Agarwal pulled out a very wristly flick. It actually went far too well for his liking, as it brought Dane Piedt down at the fence into the picture. Dives forward to complete a good catch
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
drives a fuller ball, but cannot beat Bavuma at a wide cover position
full ball, around off and middle, and he eases it with the turn towards long on
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
tossed up, and he drives this with the turn away from across his leg stump, down towards long off
defends a length ball, turning into him from outside off
drives a fuller ball down towards long on
length, and he goes back and defends this close to the stumps
fires this in at the pads, and Jadeja works it around the corner towards square leg
presses forward to defend a straight ball
wide of the crease, and tosses it up outside off. He gets to the pitch of this and eases it through covers. Wonderful stroke!

oh, takes the outside edge! Vihari looks for the turn back into him, but this goes through and turns a bit less than he expects. Catches the outer edge, but flies to the right of du Plessis at first slip. Sharp half-chance, I suppose
defends a length ball off the back foot
presses forward to defend this
flighted outside off, and into the footmarks. Some turn back into Jadeja, who offers his front leg, and nothing more
goes back to defend one turning into him
pushes his pad forward to let a ball from outside off strike him from the footmarks
tossed up, and he drives this towards midwicket. Bavuma dives to his right and stops this

flighted around off stump, and he defends this
drives a length ball towards long on
goes back to punch a length ball towards cover
flicks a shorter ball away towards square leg. There's a slight misfield, but they're happy with the one here
fuller, and he drives this hard, but cannot beat Bavuma at a silly mid on position
length, and he presses forward to defend
goes back and taps a length ball away towards square leg
length ball turning in from outside off. Gets a big stride forward and cops this on the pad
short of a length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
full on leg stump, steps out and clips it to mid-on's right
length outside off, gets forward and flicks to midwicket's left
length on off stump, defended with soft hands on the front foot

length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
thick inside edge down to fine leg. Length ball on middle stump, looks to drive on the up but not to the pitch of this
short of a length outside off, sliced out to deep backward square
yorker length just outside off, jammed back down the pitch
full outside off, leans in and drives to long-on

that looks close on the lbw. South Africa review. First review of the match. Length ball skids through and raps him in front of the stumps. He stepped out, but that's not very high, caught him below the knee roll as he hurriedly pushed at this. Got trapped by his own stride and was also beaten by pace. No bat on it...hit him in front of middle...going onto hit leg stump, but he'll be saved because he's past the 3 metre mark thanks to his stride. That's the margin for an accurate prediction of the ball's path, so it will save Vihari
beaten. Length ball rips away from the bat as he has a poke at it

taken at long-off. Vihari's first home innings ends in a frenzy. Flat length ball outside off, he steps out and has a hurried swish at it. It's off the low part of the bat and is taken well inside the boundary
length on middle stump, defended off the inside part of the bat
full on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
length outside off, opens the face and runs it out to deep point
short of a length outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
edged and comfortably between keeper and gully. Length ball in the corridor. Defends inside the line and opens the face on it. Gets off the mark
length on off stump, defended into the covers
steered to the third man boundary! Fully intentional. Gully had moved to slip, and he's opened the face to get it through exactly there. Length outside off and he leans in and opens the face
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up wide outside off, reaches out and drives to long-off's right. He fumbles there. Looks like Piedt
length ball turning in at off stump. Cramps him as he shapes to punch through the off side

swiped over the midwicket boundary with typical Jadeja flourish. No hesitation, no half-measures and as a lot of young people would say, no chill. Length ball lobbed up at off stump, gets down the pitch and clobbers it with the turn
length ball flat outside off. Looks for the reverse sweep, jams it onto his pad
big turn down leg side. Short of a length on leg stump and that climbs and bounces past QDK's hands. First byes of the innings
short of a length on middle stump, clips to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length outside off, shuffles and dabs it through square leg off the back foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
big appeal from QDK for lbw. Short of a length ball hits him in front of leg. Again, not too high. Piedt with a delayed appeal. No review. That might not have been a bad shout...
full ball outside off, gets low and opens the face against the turn to deflect this past short third man
full on leg stump, onto the pads as he looks to flick
length outside off, defended into the covers
full outside off, gets down for the paddle sweep but that jumps up and hits him in the chest
swatted to the square leg boundary! Length ball slanted in at middle stump, gets low and has a big heave at it to get it to deep midwicket's right
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover
length outside off, driven to sweeper cover
short of a length slider outside off, backs away to cut and gets an under-edge to first slip's right
short of a length outside off, punched to backward point off the back foot
length ball angled in at off stump. Hurriedly defended to point from the crease

leading edge and it goes to third man. Short of a length on off stump, closes the face too early and it's right off the spine of the bat through where slip would have been. But much like when I bowl offspin, the captain hasn't given him a slip
straight to deep midwicket! A smile from Piedt. And then he covers his face. It's halfway down the pitch, turning in at leg stump and he gets the pull shot off the low part of the bat
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, turning in at off stump. Pushed to extra cover
short of a length on off stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length outside off, slices to deep backward point
full outside off, driven to extra cover with the turn
big turn. Length ball in at off stump. He defend close to the body on angle but that turns a long long way past the edge
survives the run out chance at the non-striker's end. Length on middle, defended to square leg's right off the inside part. Jadeja hares down the pitch and back, Ashwin is unmoved. No direct hit
length on middle stump, steps out and pushed to midwicket
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
keeps low. Length ball outside off, backs away to cut and this is under the bat, shin height
big turn past the outside edge. Oh it's turning now. Length ball drifted nicely in from around the wicket, steep climb past the edge
length on leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
short of a length on leg stump, whipped with the angle to deep square's left
length and in at off stump. Backs away and cuts to short third's left off the under edge
full on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
refuses the single. Short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to deep backward point
takes the single this time to the exact fielder. Short and wide outside off, cut firmly to deep backward point
full outside off, driven to extra cover
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
low and beats the edge. Short of a length outside off, shapes to cut that but can't
length on off stump, driven to extra cover
short of a length on off stump, punched to extra cover's right
length on middle stump, steps out and chips this to long-on
length on off stump, steps out and is forced to tap to short midwicket
length and keeping low as it turns towards the stumps. Shuffles and whips to midwicket
length ball tossed up outside off, flicked to short midwicket
precise, length ball, shaping away from Elgar, who pushes forward to defend
length, and some extra bounce as it angles across Elgar, who withdraws his bat well ahead of time. That will encourage both Ishant and Shami
length, angles away, and lifts off a length again. Elgar has a close look at it, but keeps his bat well out of the way
length, closer to the stumps this time, and Elgar drops it dead at his feet, close to his body
full, but way down the leg side. There's a fine leg in place, but Elgar flicks this way to the right of the man there. Easy pickings!
fuller, and some good bounce again from just outside off stump. Elgar was anyway shaping to leave, but appeared a bit surprised by how much that ball reared up
full, outside off, and Markram lets this pass
full, on the pads, and he flicks it away, but cannot beat midwicket
length, straight at the stumps again, and he eases it away towards midwicket
length, just outside off, this time delivered at 141kph, and he leaves this
length, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend this
length, angles into him, and keeps a tad low, but Markram is nicely behind it and can defend it away towards midwicket
length ball, in the channel outside off, seaming away, and Elgar lets it pass
fuller, moves away after pitching, and Elgar ends up chasing this. No touch through to Saha, as the South African opener exhales after being beaten
fuller ball, straighter too, but Elgar is nicely behind the line of it to defend
fuller, straighter, and he drives this towards mid off
length, angles in towards Elgar, who defends from the crease. Good bowling, as he began from outside off, and is slowly moving closer to the stumps. Might throw one wide soon...
oh it is wide, but down the leg side, and Elgar gets enough bat to run it down to the fine leg fence
goes back to drive this back down the pitch
defends to the off side, off hte back foot
sharp turn and bounce! Tossed up outside off, and invited the big drive from Markram. It went through, but spun and bounced over leg stump
shorter in length, and allows him to go back and push this past point
straighter one, from a good length, and Elgar goes back and adjusts well in time to keep this out
tossed up, straighter, and he drives it off the inside of the bat towards mid on. Not in control, but good enough from Elgar
half-tracker, wide outside off, and allows Markram to hang back and smash this away to the point boundary
presses forward to defend a ball outside off
goes back to defend a flat, quick one
goes back to drive a length ball towards extra cover
presses forward to defend one tossed up around off
turns from leg stump, and runs off the outside edge, as Markram shapes to flick. Goes along the ground past second slip
length ball, from around the stumps, and he defends off the crease
angles into him, and he covers the line of this and plays it away towards midwicket
defends a length ball around off stump
length, on off stump, and he drops it with a dead bat
flicks a shortish ball towards square leg
hangs back to a length ball, that keeps a bit low, but gives him enough time to defend
length, defended towards midwicket
defended towards midwicket
slower, and straighter, and he pushes towards midwicket
flighted further, and he drives with the turn from outside off, towards mid on

run-out opportunity, but missed by India! Straight ball, that kept a bit low, and was played away by Elgar towards midwicket. It went to the left of Pujara, who attacked the ball well, and forced Elgar to send Markram back from the non-striker's end. Markram had to put the dive in, in the end, but it wouldn't have mattered as Pujara mised with a direct hit attempt
rears off a length, but Elgar does well to defend a ball turning in from outside off

GOT 'IM! This time it doesn't bounce over the stumps. Ashwin tosses this up outside off, with some furious revs on it, and Markram presses forward to defend. Leaves a slight gap between bat and pad, though, and that's where the ball sneaks through and goes on to rattle the timber behind him. Ashwin throws his right arm up in celebration. Smart bowling, as he's giving the ball some flight, but keeps varying the line and length
length, some good turn into him, and he defends from the crease
this one goes the other way! Length, just outside off, and curves away a touch. De Bruyn looks to defend from the crease, but misses out
strikes him on the pads, and India appeal loudly. They eventually decide against the review! Beat him from outside off with the sharp turn, but he had done well to get outside the line
presses forward to defend a length ball
flighted around off, and he reverse-whips this away for four towards third man
defends a length ball around off stump
chances his arm to a regulation length ball outside off. Comes down the wicket and gets an upper edge as he looks to go down the ground. Skewed in the air, but wide of the man at deep point
defends a length ball away to the on side
blocks a length ball on the stumps
defends a length ball
plays a straight, quick ball on to the on side
floated around off stump, goes straighter on, and de Bruyn goes back to defend this watchfully
slower, outside off, and he goes back and punches this towards mid on
presses forward to meet a length ball around off stump
shorter in length, and he goes back to punch this through covers. Pujara dives away to his right and cuts this off from a wide cover position
goes wide of the crease, and fires this in towards the off stump. De Bruyn defends watchfully
floated up around off, and he uses his long levers to get close to it and smother the turn
length, outside off, and he defends this from the crease
length, and he uses his feet, and plays this with the turn this time. Made no attempt to keep it down, and the sweet swing of the blade fetches him a maximum over long on
fires it in at middle and leg, and he defends
similar line to the previous ball, and he plays a risky but well-controlled flick to the right of short leg. Easy single on offer
length, at the leg stump, and he presses forward to smother the spin on this
length, and he goes back to defend a ball around off stump
tossed up around off, and he defends from the crease
straighter, flatter, and he flicks this away towards midwicket
presses forward and defends a length ball around off stump
tossed up around middle, and he blocks this from the crease
length, and he defends from the crease
tossed up, and it goes off the outer part of the bat, but along the ground to Mayank Agarwal
length, moving away from de Bruyn, who has a waft at it. Misses out by a big margin, but would do better not to poke at anything outside off
length, homing in on off stump this time, and he defends this from the crease
straighter, and he whips this away towards mid on
length, shapes into him, and he defends this watchfully, close to his body
length, just outside off, and he defends from the crease

length, a bit of shape back in, and de Bruyn lets it pass. I suspect it wasn't as close to the off stump as Shami's exaggerated response (hands to head, lips puckered, etc.) suggest, but that was a close one to let go off
tossed up around off stump, and he goes back to defend
flicks away a length ball around off stump towards midwicket
drives a length ball, tossed up around off, towards midwicket, where Kohli makes a good stop, diving away to his left
flighted around off and middle, and he plays this with the turn towards square leg
flighted outside off, and he lets this pass
flatter, straighter, and he gets behind the line and defends
drives a length ball towards cover
floated up to the off stump from around the wicket, and he looks to flick. Goes off the outer edge, but along the ground, past silly point
presses forward to smother a length ball around off stump
defends a length ball off the back foot
tossed up, and he drives this towards wide cover
flighted, and he drives this towards point
fired flatter, and towards the leg side. De Bruyn can go back and get this on his pads as he looks to whip it away. Gets a leg bye for his troubles
slow, outside off, and gives Elgar enough time to drive this through the covers. Won't go all the way to the fence, but far enough to allow him to pick up two
defends a length ball outside off
length, outside off, and he plays inside the line of this
defends a length ball
drives a length ball down towards mid on
tossed up around middle, and he defends
flighted around off, and he drives this towards point

Ashwin gets de Bruyn...superb glovework from Saha! Floated up around off stump, and it just kept going with the angle. De Bruyn has been happy to use his reach to try and get to the pitch of the ball often, and his back leg just slid a shade out of the crease as he did so, and that instant was enough for Saha to whip the bails off. In fact, given out caught, as there was a slight inside edge on that. So de Bruyn may have been given out in any case, but he was honest enough to start walking as soon as that ball was snaffled by Saha behind the stumps. It continues to be a terrific opening burst from R Ashwin
presses forward, and the ball pops up off his pad. Taken by forward short leg, but India are quick to quieten down after the initial appeal is turned down
presses forward to defend a length ball
goes back and defends a length ball around off stump
drives this with the spin, off the back foot, towards square leg. Enough time to go back for the second
flicked away towards midwicket

GOT 'IM! Darts one in from wide of the crease, and Piedt was playing for the turn as he stretched forward. Went through him, and dislodged the middle stump in the process. The Indian spinners beginning to make merry!
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
DROPPED! Plays this off the back foot, as the ball rushes on to him, and he flicks this towards Vihari. Goes in and pops out
tossed up, and he plays this late with the outer part of his bat, towards point
flighted around off stump, and he drives this back down the pitch
slower through the air, towards leg stump, and he flicks this away towards midwicket
tossed up around off, and he defends off the front foot
floated wider outside off, and he lets it pass
length, and he plays it away towards mid on
floated about off stump, and he hangs back in the crease and then punches it towards deep point. Shami runs across from point and keeps the scoring down to two
defends a length ball around off stump
tossed up, and turns sharply across him, takes the inside edge, and flies past leg gully, low to his right!
plays a length ball around off stump with a dead bat
flighted outside off, and he presses forward to defend
defends a length ball towards silly mid on
presses forward to smother a length ball
