dies on the keeper. Welcome to day 3. Length ball wide outside off, left alone. Saha gathers on the bounce

between the slips! It's a wide first slip and a third slip in there. Bavuma's attempted drive has flown right through the middle. Length ball outside off, feet rooted on the pitch as he throws his hands away from the body
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball moving away late outside off, left alone
full and curved in at off stump. Neatly driven with the full face, back to the bowler
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot. That came in with the arm
past the outside edge. Length ball wide outside off, hangs the bat inside the line on the forward defence
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
just past off stump! Whew, that was close! Another length ball that slides in with the arm. Elgar expects that to turn and exposes his off stump as he tries to leave
length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up full outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
length and shape into off stump. Solidly behind this to defend from the crease
length ball angled in at off stump, defended into the covers
shot! Lovely timing on the flick. Overpitched and drifted into the pads. Holds his shape beautifully as he gets this between short midwicket and the squarer midwicket fielder
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball on leg stump, allows that to come on and tickles it through the vacant square leg region
length and in at off stump, nicely behind the line to defend to mid-off
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
length at middle and off, defended to point on the front foot
length ball lobbed up wide outside off, left alone
length ball drifted in at off stump, defended past silly point
lifted over mid-on. Typically Elgar. Length ball slanted into his stumps and he just uses that angle to chip this over the fielder
length at the stumps, defended into the off side
length ball outside off, leans into this and punches firmly to cover's right
length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
length on leg stump, defended from the crease
past the wide slip fielder and into the third man boundary. Nicely played here, he got right behind the line and defended into the turf. Opened the face late at this length ball
length ball angled in and then holds its line as he drives on the up to mid-off. Bit of risk in that shot
length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover via silly point
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and floated up at off stump. Solidly defended on the front foot
round-arm and sliding in at middle stump. Blocked on the front foot
tossed up just outside off, half a stride to get to the pitch and he drives with the angle again. This time along to floor to beat mid-on to his right

trapped right in front! And he won't review. That's jagged back in from a length and caught him on the back leg in front of middle stump. It's a length ball slammed into the pitch outside off. He looks to drive on the up for the original line but this is a long way past his inside edge. Wasn't rising either. Dead in front
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball in the corridor, shuffles and lets that go
length on leg stump, leans in and clips to short midwicket
full on middle stump, flicked watchfully to the squarer short midwicket
length ball just outside off, solidly defended into the covers
length and angled into leg stump. Pushed to mid-on with soft hands
length on middle, pushed into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to short leg
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
length on off stump, dropped into the pitch off the back foot
length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick and cops that on the knee roll as he looks to flick. Might have been an inside edge on that
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short and wide outside off, opens the face and runs to backward point
short of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at off stump, solidly blocked from the crease
length on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket off the toe end
length ball pushed through flat outside off. Inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
whipped past backward square. Full and flat outside off, shuffles and swishes. Gets this off the thick inside edge
in front of square this time. Length ball on off stump, shuffles and sweeps off the cue end of the bat. But safely to the square leg boundary
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, steps out and drives to mid-on
length and must outside off. Defended on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length on off stump, punched firmly on the up to mid-off's left
length on leg stump, flicked with the angle to fine leg
whistles through square leg. Overpitched on leg stump and he flicks aerially. India won't mind aerial with two short midwickets in there, but this is brilliantly placed
length outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, pushed out to mid-off with the turn
leading edge but safely into the covers. Short of a length and sticking in the pitch as he closes the face to defend this
short of a length and turning outside off, tapped to cover with an angled bat
length on leg stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
and another over mid-on. A pioneer of gently rolling a ball into the long-on boundary. This is too full from Ashwin, up at off stump. Gets the front leg out of the way and lofts it over mid-on
length ball with some late curve away from middle stump. Defended on the front foot
length ball into middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked with the angle to fine leg
short of a length just outside off, pushed into the covers on the up
full outside off, sliced on the up to backward point
full on off stump, driven to mid-off's right off the toe-end
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, driven to mid-off's right
length on off stump, defended off the inside half

lovely shot! Wow. Length ball on off stump, decisive use of the feet to jump down the track and then tee off from there - launched into the sightscreen. He's done this before at this venue during the IPL
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on off stump, solidly defended on the back foot
thick inside edge down to long leg. Looks to defend this length ball outside off and this pings between the two close catchers
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
short of a length and staying low outside off. Watches it closely as he gets deep and clips this wide of mid-on
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, defended on the front foot with the turn
flighted around off, and he presses forward to defend this
presses forward to meet a ball tossed out outside off. Doesn't turn as much, and he adjusts well to defend
defends a length ball around off stump
flicks a length ball from middle and off towards midwicket
fuller, on the pads, and he can drive this down towards deep mid on
length, and he gets behind the line of this one. It straightens after pitching on middle, and he defends this right under his eyes
length, just outside off, and he presses forward to defend. Runs off the outer part of the bat towards point
fuller, and he presses forward to defend. Runs off the face of the bat, along the ground, and runs through to silly point
drives a fuller ball to cover
fuller ball, but on the pads, and he can tickle this around the corner towards square leg for a single
sweeps, and places this beautifully! It was a flatter ball, and around middle, and he fetched it well and got it square enough to evade a man at fine leg
defends a length ball to the leg side
length, and he goes back to defend this. Drops it with a dead bat towards leg gully
presses forward to defend a length ball on off stump
sweeps from outside off, and gets it through to the deep backward square leg fence
flighted around leg stump, and he nurdles this along the ground towards leg gully
fuller, straighter, and he can get this towards deep mid on
length, and he plays this late, allowing it to slant into him, before playing it towards point with soft hands
tossed up around off, and he presses forward to defend
some turn on offer, and he defends off the front foot
drives a fuller ball with the turn towards backward point
drives a fuller ball down the wicket towards long on, with the turn
presses forward to defend a length ball around off

he has dragged this one down! That bounces about five times before it goes through to Saha, as Jadeja is unable to get this ball away properly. Strays down the leg side, and du Plessis shapes to hit it, but allows it to trundle through
flight, outside off on a good length, and he drives this towards cover

fuller ball, and he drives this down to long on. Gets to fifty! Top knock, as he has knuckled down in typical Elgar fashion, but every now and then also put away a few balls that have provided scoring opportunities
fires this fuller, and he drives it down to deep mid on
fuller, and he drives this towards deep mid on
tosses this up a touch, turns away from middle towards leg, and he plays this with the turn towards backward square leg
flighted, around off, and he drives this elegantly through the covers. Not much of feet movement, but does well with his hands, enabling it to go wider of the man at short cover
turns away from a good length, and he lets it pass
tossed up around leg stump, and he plays this carefully towards square leg
goes back to defend a ball tossed up around off and middle
slants one across him, and he plays this with soft hands. Runs off the edge, and goes well to the right of first slip, and runs away to the third man boundary
slants another across du Plessis, who presses forward and gets it towards point. It's to the left of the fielder, and that enables them to go through for a single
flighted, and he drives this with the turn towards deep mid on. Du Plessis, interestingly, was waiting for a long time before taking off
defended back down the wicket
big turn, as it pitches around middle and goes down the leg side. Didn't miss the inside edge, or leg stump, by much
driven with the turn towards deep mid on
fires this one with the angle from around the stumps, and goes on with the arm. Du Plessis defends from the crease
some extra bounce, but quicker through the air, and he defends from the crease. Around off stump
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
sharp turn! Tossed up around off, and bites and grips as it bounces away from his extended blade. No touch, thankfully, as it goes through to Wriddhiman Saha
angles into him, and he plays it off the back foot towards midwicket
goes back and plays a ball straightening into him towards square leg
flicked away towards square leg
defends a length ball around leg stump
flatter, towards the leg stump, and he goes back and defends this towards midwicket
flighted, and he looks to drive towards cover. Goes off the outer edge of the blade and carries towards cover point instead
tossed up around middle, and he has launched into this one, but got more height than distance... It's good enough to just about hit the skirting at midwicket on the full, though
defends a length ball around middle and leg
taps away a flatter ball fired at his pads
strays down the pads, and Elgar turns this around towards fine leg. Just needed to get some bat on that, and that was enough for the ball to race away...
tossed up, around leg, and he looks to whip this around the corner. On the bounce, and into the hands of forward short leg

he has absolutely smashed this one! Tossed up a touch more, around middle and leg, and he takes on long on, and ends up clearing him quite easily with a full-blooded swing down the ground. Hits this flatter than most, and does so by keeping his bat at a slight tilt. There was no intent to go for anything less than six, though!
fullish length, slants into du Plessis, who defends this towards mid on
SHOT! Full, angles into du Plessis, and he just allows the angle and the pace of the ball to work for him, and whips this between short midwicket and mid on. It races away for four
fuller, wider of off stump, and he drives this towards mid off. There's a hint of reverse swing on offer, but the lack of pace on the pitch is also apparent, giving the batsmen enough time to adjust
changes his length, and the pace, with a slower off-cutter along the middle of the pitch. Du Plessis stays rooted inside the crease and defends
length, swings in a touch from outside off, and he is nicely behind the line of this to defend

rears off a length, and surprises everybody! Was no different in origin as the previous ball, just on a good length around off stump, but then pitches and moves away viciously, with some extra bounce to boot. Du Plessis was shaping to defend this, but was forced to move away to get his body and bat out of the way. There was a bit of bounce and some movement, doubtless, but again not at an alarming pace
defends a length ball around off stump
is that a drop? Length ball, around off stump, and Elgar pokes a bit at it, and gets the outside edge, and Saha cannot hang on to it. It was a decent chunk of the bat, and also didn't go to slip
defends a length ball towards off and middle
looks to sweep from outside off, and it strikes him on the pad. Hopeful appeal, but the Indians know the impact would have been outside the line
pushes a length ball with the turn towards deep mid on
fuller, and he can flick this away towards midwicket. Played with soft hands, and allows them to go through for a single
a hint of reverse, from a good length, and it jags back into du Plessis, who defends from the crease
angles into him, and he runs it down towards long leg
length, outside off, and he runs it down towards the man at a wide slip
in the channel outside off, and he shoulders arms as the ball carries on from a good length
shorter, angles into him, and he plays it away towards midwicket
length, outside off, and he pokes at it deliberately, looks to run it down towards third man. Rahane at the gully/fourth slip dives away to his left and cuts this off
length, around off, and he presses forward to defend
shorter, and he goes back and whips this to the left of square leg. Played with soft hands, so there's enough time for them to get a single
fuller, and he fetches it from off stump to drive it down towards long on
defends a length ball
fires this along the angle into du Plessis from around the wicket. He presses forward to defend, and it runs along the ground off the inside of the bat
looks to drive this towards cover, but hits it hard into the pitch. No chance for a single, as it goes quickly to the fieldsman there
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend this
length, outside off, doesn't shape away as Elgar initially anticipates. He withdraws his bat as he leaves. Good bit of bowling from Ishant there!
length, around off, and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, and keeps a tad low as Elgar shapes to defend. Sneaks under his bat, but wasn't directed at the stumps. Creeps through to Saha
fuller, but straying down the pads. A little quicker in pace, and it beats Elgar, who shapes to flick. A stifled appeal, but more from the fieldsmen behind the wicket
length, around off, and he plays it away defensively towards point
length, and he goes back and whips it away from the pads. It runs away towards the square leg fence, beating Kuldeep Yadav, who is on as a substitute
presses forward to defend a length ball
stretches to defend a length ball at the stumps
sharp turn again! Fired in across him on a good length, and it turns and bounces sharply away, and beats his outside edge. A good take by Saha, high to his right
fires this at his pads, and he flicks it away, but cannot get it past square leg
flighted around off, and he presses forward to defend, and then nonchalantly walks off for lunch
length and into the pads. Leans in and clips this square of midwicket with a closed face
length ball outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side with the angle
beats him and climbs over off stump. Length ball angles in and straightens. Looks to defend this on leg stump
length and in at leg stump, deflected to midwicket's left off the pad as he looks to flick
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and turning into off stump. Defended on the back foot
inside edge as he lobs this right up outside off. Gets forward to defend but that turns in and keeps low
quicker length ball outside off, hurriedly poked into the covers off the back foot
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, defended to extra cover
short of a length and into middle stump. Cops this on the thigh guard as he looks to flick
length outside off, pushes at this in front of the body. Off the inside half of the bat as the bottom hand comes off
length and into the pads. Looks to flick, deflected down to fine leg off the pad
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left off the back foot with soft hands and that is fifty for Faf du Plessis. it's been a delightfully positive, confident innings from the captain
beats the outside edge. Lovely ball. Slammed into a length on middle stump, onto the seam. Jags away late and climbs over the stumps after beating him
length on middle stump, punched to mid-on with the curve in
length on off stump, defended to cover
clears mid-on. Length outside off, reaches out for it and looks to chip. Gets it off the toe-end
length on off stump, defended to silly point
length on off stump, defended to extra cover
one bounce and over the boundary! Full and flat at off stump and playing right into his arc. Lofts him over his head AGAIN. This one is flat
full on off stump, driven to mid-off with the turn
length and in at middle stump, punched to mid-on on the rise and a fumble there from Vihari gives them a run
length on off stump, defended from the crease
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
length on leg stump, defended to mid-on with the angle
full and into leg stump. Looks to flick and gets an inside edge onto pad
full on leg stump, defended to midwicket
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, defended to short square off the inside half
sprints away into the square leg boundary. Full on middle stump, gets very low and sweeps this firmly to the left of deep square leg
length on middle stump, flicked uppishly towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off, walks into this forward defence and cops it on the pad

through the packed leg side infield! Lovely. There's a square catcher, straight catcher, and a conventional midwicket. But he's got this full ball into the midwicket boundary with lovely timing on the flick
length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
length and just outside off, dead-batted into the off side
full outside off, sweetly driven to mid-off
length on leg stump, an uppish bunt towards short midwicket as he checks his shot

and yet another one trickles into the boundary. Even when he drives firmly, a hand gets in the way and makes sure Elgar's boundary only gently touches the padding. It's a lovely drive to a length ball on middle, mid-on's dive to the right can't stop it
length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
length and turning into leg stump. Deep in the crease to guide this into the leg side
full on off stump, flicked to short midwicket

he's nudged that straight to leg slip! Oh that is soft, Faf is livid with himself. Ashwin slows it down and gets him to push in front of the body. It's a length ball landed just outside off. A hint of bounce to that. He closes the face and hits it into the mid-riff of Pujara who grabs onto it. A solid knock ends tamely
full outside off, looks to drive through cover and gets it to mid-on off the inside edge
length on off stump, defended to short point

glorious drive. Tossed up outside off, gets very far forward and low, then opens the face late and drives to bisect the two close-in fielders and then beat extra cover to his right. Mayank there, gives chase and pulls it back in with a slide
full ball outside off, nice stride out and a controlled drive wide of mid-off
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch on the front foot
length outside off, defended with the turn into the leg side

nicely forward for the drive again, and this time it just keeps running away from mid-off! Lovely timing. Full and flat outside off. Takes out the turn with the big stride and drives against the turn. Too quick for Ashwin
length on off stump, defended to short leg on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked back to the bowler
length and angled into off stump. Defended to cover on the front foot
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side with the angle
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot

brings up his century with a slog sweep! That is a brutal hit from a guy who has been controlled and deft in what has been an expert innings on a turning pitch. Length ball coming into off stump with the angle, as it has all day from Ashwin and he gets down and pummels this over the midwicket boundary. What an innings
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
checks the cut and that lands short of cover by a safe distance. Turns in more than he expects as he shapes for the cut
length on off stump, punched to point off the back foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
dropped. Rohit Sharma is not low enough at silly point. Length ball on off stump, looks to flick and gets it off the leading edge. Rohit only manages to get an instinctive right hand to it
length on middle stump, into the pad as he looks to flick
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left
full outside off, driven to mid-off's right and he steals a run. They've sent it upstairs for the run-out. The bail fell down after the ball kissed Jadeja's hands. Elgar is in though
length at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to leg slip
full outside off, defended down the pitch
length and in at leg stump, pushed into the midwicket region
length and coming in with the angle. Closes the face and tucks this fine from the crease
length on the stumps, defended on the front foot
full outside off, driven into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side
beats the outside edge. Haven't been a lot of these today. Drifts in, lands at a length and spins past the defence
presses forward to defend a length ball turning into him
length, goes back, and it turns slowly across him. Stays a bit low, but he has ample time to turn this away towards long leg
flicks a fuller ball on middle and leg towards deep backward square leg
length, flicked away towards Virat Kohli at midwicket
tries to slog a length ball across the line, and it nearly carries to the fielder at a slightly wider midwicket position. Close!
defends a length ball at the stumps
goes back and defends a length that angles into him from around the stumps
length ball, straighter, and he can shuffle across and whip this away to the left of midwicket
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward to defend a length ball tossed up around off and middle
length, a bit straighter, and he defends. Turns less than he anticipates, but he gets some bat on to it
presses forward and smothers the turn on a length ball flighted around off
length, turns into him, and he flicks this away towards midwicket
looks to sweep a ball from outside off, and misses. A sharp, loud appeal to begin with, but they quieten down quite quickly
defends a length ball angling into him
length ball, turns into him, and he plays it with the turn, just falling short of short leg
moves across the crease to cover the line of a length ball angling into him. Defends from the crease
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, outside off, and he drives it towards cover
length, angles into him, and he drives it towards mid on
tossed up, just outside off, and he drives this hard, but cannot beat the man at a wide cover
slants into him from around the wicket, slightly quicker in the air, and he defends. Attempt at a carrom ball
length, and he lofts this over mid on. It bounces a couple of times before trundling across the long on boundary. A bit of toe-end of the bat, but with no fielder by the ropes, it was a safe shot

length, outside off, and he drives this late, and beautifully! Wide cover has no chance, as he places this to his right, going right through the point region. Gorgeous timing and placement on that shot from QdK
length, and he plays this with soft hands towards point. They set off for a quick single, and make it quite easily
tosses this up around off, and he slog-sweeps this. There were shouts of 'catch-it' from the bowler, but it went far enough to speed away from the inner ring, and eventually over the fence
length, outside off, and he deliberately runs this down to the third man boundary, using the pace of the ball!
defends a length ball at middle and off
defends a straighter length ball
shuffles across and defends a length ball at his stumps from the crease
outside off, and he drives this towards deep point
tossed up, around off stump, and he comes forward to drive this towards deep point
fuller, and he drives this towards deep mid on
short, and he goes back and cuts this away towards backward point. Terrific timing again from de Kock!
presses forward to defend a length ball at the stumps
length, but he goes back and plays this from just outside off after allowing it to turn a touch. Runs this towards short third man
length, outside off, and he defends with a slight forward press
length, and he presses forward and defends this towards point
length, outside off, and he defends this off the front foot, driving it towards mid off

short of a length, angles back in to him, and takes him by surprise with some extra bounce. Runs off his glove towards fine leg. Overstepped in trying for some extra effort, but the bounce definitely did surprise Elgar!
length, and he comes down with a straight bat to drop it dead at the crease
length, outside off, and he drives this towards cover point. A good diving stop there prevents any runs
shorter in length, and a bit wide too. He hangs back and cuts it towards point, considers a single, but then changes his mind as he finds Ravindra Jadeja bearing down on the ball to his right
presses forward to meet a length ball just outside off
shorter in length, and he goes back and cuts this to the left of Mayank Agarwal at short third man
length, keeps low, and he looks to go back and cut this. It sneaks under his inside edge, through to Saha. A mini-appeal, but they knew he had missed it
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, and he goes back to cut this towards deep point
full toss around off, and he drives this down towards long on
short in length, outside off, and he steers it down towards third man
fuller, and he plays a delightful, wristly flick that takes it speeding past midwicket. Doesn't go all the way to the fence, though
length, a bit slower, just outside off, and he chases it a bit, trying to run it down towards third man. Can't make contact, though
length, angles into him, and he shapes to flick, but gets him on in the inner thigh
presses forward to defend a length ball outside off
jags back off a length, and he defends this by slicing it towards point
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
shorter, outside off, a bit quicker, and he goes back to defend this from the crease
fuller, flatter, and down the leg side. He tries to flick this across, but cannot lay bat on it
thrashes a straighter, length ball down to long on
fuller ball, on the pads, but he shuffles across to the leg side and looks to drive this through covers
tucks a full ball on his pads away towards backward square leg
defends a length ball on the stumps
angles in from around the wicket, but strays down the pads, as de Kock looks to flick but is beaten
length, angles across him, and he can flick this away towards long leg
length, angles across him, and he flicks it away towards short leg
fuller, towards the pads, and he defends this towards square leg. Delivered at about 136kph
length, outside off, and he pokes it away to the right of point
fuller, on the pads, and he whips this away towards deep square leg
fuller, outside off, and he drives this away towards extra cover
fuller, and he drives it to cover
wide of the crease, rifles this in, and he goes back to punch this towards cover
a bit more flight, but he stays in his crease, presses slightly forward and drives towards cover
keeps low! Bowled from wide of the crease, and also overstepping as he delivered, but was straight at the stumps and kept quite low. Elgar did well to keep it out, though
defends a length ball around off stump
defends a shorter ball, just outside off
fullish length, on the pads, and he flicks this away towards square leg
on the pads, no great pace (122kph) and he flicks it away towards long leg
length, straight along the leg stump line, and he plays it away towards square leg
length, and he defends from the crease
fuller, angles across him, a bit quicker at 138kph, and he defends this from the crease with a dead bat
length, and he defends this straight ball
defends a length ball towards cover
flicks a full ball towards midwicket
drives a straight ball back towards the bowler
flighted outside off, and he drives to cover
presses forward to defend a length ball
tossed up, at the off stump, and he defends cautiously from the crease, pressing forward as he played the shot

full ball, and he brings his bat straight down. It's a teasing one for Shubman Gill, who's on the field at mid on as a sub, but it eludes his dive. Just fingertips away from keeping it back in, but what a super shot!
length, straight at the stumps, and he plays a compact defensive push towards short midwicket
drops it with soft hands towards cover and pinches a quick single
length, and strikes de Kock on the pads as he shapes to flick. A half-appeal from Shami, but that was pitching way outside leg!
length, and he drives it towards midwicket
length, angles into him, and he flicks it away, but cannot beat the man stationed at square leg
tosses this up around off, and he presses forward to defend
slow, low, and doesn't really turn as it slants across him. Elgar stays low and flicks this away towards midwicket
drives a fuller ball towards cover

floats this down the leg side, and he gets a tickle on it towards fine leg. Shami runs in from long leg and fires in a flat throw, but cannot beat de Kock, as he races back for two. Might have been closer if he had secured a direct hit
floated around off stump, and de Kock waits a bit, and then launches this inside out through the extra cover region. Top shot!
length, he allows this to angle into him, and drops it with a dead bat
length, and he presses forward to defend this
angles into him from around the wicket, wide of the crease, and he defends this from the crease
tossed up outside off, and he clears his front leg and drives this hard, and through covers. Terrific shot again from Elgar!
follows the boundary up by poking a length ball around off towards point. Sets off for a single, and goes through quite comfortably
presses forward to defend a length ball

fuller length, and he drives this back towards Vihari, who dives away to his right to take the ball. The crowd thinks there might have been a catch there. Or maybe they are just in need of something to cheer up
tossed up, and he drives this towards cover. Pitched around leg. Didn't really turn a lot
tossed up around leg, and he defends off the front foot
tossed up, and he drives this to the right of Jadeja at mid off. Jadeja gets across quickly to it, but they go through for a quick single
tossed up, and he drives this to covers

fuller, and he drives, but gets an under edge. The ball hits the ground and lodges in his pad-flaps. Mayank Agarwal collects it from silly point, and then gives a playful half-hug to de Kock. Smiles all around
fuller, wider, and he plays a gorgeous square drive through point. Takes de Kock to 49!
drops a length ball with a dead bat towards midwicket
fuller, and he drives this back down the pitch to the left of Jadeja, who now comes around the wicket
turns a ball from around leg stump towards square leg
length, outside off, and he pokes this to the right of Shami at mid off. Celebrates his fifty with a quick bit of glove-love with his partner
drives this towards the bowler to his right

angles across Elgar, and bounces viciously! Elgar shapes to play a defensive prod, but that ball took off from a good length, and was well collected by Saha. Some smiles as Elgar suggests that this ball could have been called for one of the bouncers
defends a length ball around off
drives a length ball outside off towards point

tossed up around off, and he has gone inside out over the covers. Jadeja sprints after this, but cannot hold it back. In fact, his momentum sends him crashing into the advertisement hoardings. But he seems fine!
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, and he runs this down towards third man with an open face of the bat. Ishant Sharma goes chasing from point, and keeps them down to two
full, wide, and he drives this hard through covers. Top shot again from de Kock, who has middled every attacking shot this afternoon!
length ball, outside off, and he defends
drives this wide of mid off
defends a length ball around off, allowing it to run off the face of the bat towards third man
straight ball, from wide of the crease, and de Kock literally takes it off the stumps, and steers it along the ground past first slip, through to third man
SHOT! May have pre-empted that Vihari would be tempted to toss the next ball up, and he was waiting. Bent knee, as he slaps it through covers with a flourish of his wrists
praises forward and defends a straighter ball with a dead bat
tossed up around leg stump, and he flicks this towards midwicket
length, angles across him, and he glances this down towards fine leg
fuller, wider, and he drives this back towards Jadeja. To his left, but he is quick to get there
drives a fuller ball towards long on
fuller, and he presses forward to defend this
defends a length ball around off stump
length, and he plays it defensively, along the ground, towards silly point
shuffles across and tries to flick this fuller ball away. Goes off his thigh pad down towards fine leg
fuller, and he looks to flick this, but is beaten by the turn. Going down leg, though
defends from the crease, just pressing forward a touch
length, straightens into him, and he stretches forward to play a perfect defensive block
fuller, along the pads, and he plays a defensive dead bat towards where short leg might have been (but isn't)
slower through the air, along the pads, and he flicks it away towards square leg
defends a length ball towards midwicket
fuller, on the pads, and he whips it away towards deep midwicket. A fielder stationed about three-quarters of the way to the fence fields, but cannot prevent the single
length, and he plays it with a defensive bat towards square leg
sharp turn, as it jags back into him from around the wicket. Some bounce as well, and de Kock plays it well, with soft hands
defends a length ball straight at him
length on leg stump, turning away to off. Defended on the back foot
length on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked through square leg on the front foot
full outside off, gets the front leg out of the way and drives down the pitch
length on leg stump, defended to short leg
full on middle stump, looks to drive through cover, gets it off the thick inside edge to mid-on
beaten. Short of a length and slanted across off stump. Has a swish at this and is beaten

past the edge again! This one is fuller. A length ball in the corridor, seams away. Elgar drives with an angled bat from inside the line. Would have been beaten on line but that one also jumped up at him
length and just outside off. Defended down the pitch from deep in the crease
length on middle stump, stays low and he closes the face to defend into the leg side
length on middle and off, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length on leg stump, gets back in the crease and tucks this to fine leg's right where Pujara scrambles
stylish shot, but he can't beat extra cover. Full ball just outside off, he crunched that against the turn
beaten. Short and sliding through wide outside off. Has an aimless half-poke at this, away from the body
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket from the crease
length on off stump, leans in and flicks to long-on
full outside off, driven off the toe-end to extra cover
length ball just outside off, punched on the rise to cover
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
short ball up at the chest. Jumps up to try and dab this to fine leg, but cops it on the glove
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on's left from the crease

past the keeper! No slip in! There was one last over, and a gully. It's only the gully now. Short of a length, cross-seam ball jumps up at Elgar as he looks to defend this. He has no idea as it slams his glove and sails wide of Saha
short of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover
fired down leg side and too far away for Saha. Length ball, way outside leg, doesn't even get up. Saha is diving over it in the end

past slip but might have been intentional. Length ball outside off, gets out at it, opens the face late and the ball trickles into the boundary in complete silence. The home team and the home crowd are both a little flat right now
length on middle, flicked into the leg side
chopped to the backward point boundary and that is 150. Short and wide from Jadeja, and he just has to wait on that and use the pace
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended on the back foot
length on middle stump, stays deep in the crease and flicks to deep square
short of a length just outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, tapped to mid-off
length and just outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
length ball outside off, defended on the front foot
short of a length on off stump, gets back and flicks to deep backward square
full outside off, gets forward and flicks down to long-on
length outside off, bat-padded into the leg side
length outside off, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to square leg with the turn
length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
short ball just outside off, toe-ended pull to midwicket
short and just outside off, defended into the off side
oh wow. How did he get it there? Short ball outside off, angled-bat slap at this, but it's somehow ended up wide of mid-off. Still pretty well connected
length and in at leg stump, punched to mid-on off the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
full toss outside off, jammed out to mid-off
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, defended into the covers
was that an edge? The shoulder of the bat. Looked to cut that, but got it into Saha's leg and it fell short of Rahane at slip
length outside off, leans in and looks to drive. Gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
drilled. Full and wide and fast, throwdown-like. QDK plants the front leg out and slams it out to the extra cover boundary
short of a length outside off, punched uppishly to short extra cover
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and sliding into middle stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket's left and sent back as Jadeja swoops down on it
inside edge past short leg. Length outside off, has a jab at it away from the body
inside edge onto pad and bobs up momentarily to Saha's left, but way too wide for him to get a hand on it. A length ball outside off
and then he takes the pressure right off. This is top-class cricket. Length ball outside off and he's done pushing and nudging and edging. Brings out the reverse sweep, whips it past slip
length outside off, leans in and drives to long-on with the turn
well placed. Short of a length just outside off, gets back in the crease, watches it closely and runs it past slip off the outside part of the bat
nicely driven. Full and wide outside off, nicely to the pitch to drive this through extra cover. Home boy Vihari sprints to his left and puts in a tumble to keep it to two
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side on the front foot
rips past the outside edge. Drifted in at off stump, draws him into the forward defence but that's turned too much for the edge
full on off stump, tapped back towards the bowler
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended to extra cover
length outside off, defended down the pitch on the front foot
past the edge. Length ball sliding through outside off. Looks to defend that and is a bit late on it. Might have jammed his bat onto pad as he did so, because India appealed passionately for a moment

sprinting in and tumbling, is Pujara as he lunges forward to hold on to this top edge at square leg. Came running in from the boundary. Takes the catch for his Saurashtra buddy's 200th Test wicket. Elgar was disappointed as soon as this left the bat - a length ball outside off, he wanted to sweep. Ended up getting underneath it and got a top edge. Pujara, in all his slow-mo bustling glory, took it side on and made sure to hold it as he went to ground. A memorable innings from Elgar has ended. Standing ovation for him
short of a length on off stump, shuffles and defends to short leg
length on leg stump, glanced out to deep backward square
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, driven to extra cover
slapped past point. Length ball outside off, gets on his knee, reaches out and chops it with great timing
full on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-off
dropped! A tough chance to the left for Rahane. Length ball outside off, looks to drive and gets a thick edge. Rahane stretches to his left but it's too much to do
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, looks to drive through cover, thick inside edge to midwicket
cuts through him as he walks into the off side to try and defend an incoming delivery. Cops it on the flap
length outside off, pushed into the covers
length on off stump, shuffles and defends to short leg off the inside of the bat
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
full on off stump, driven down to long-off
length and in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
full at off stump, nearly yorks himself with the big stride. Defends onto his boot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to mid-off
off the thigh to second slip. Muthusamy is committing on the front foot here. Is caught off guard by a short of a length delivery he should have been back too. Squared up as he looks to defend
past the edge as he fires one in flat. Nervous prod at it and no idea in the end
full ball around off, and he pulls out a full-blooded square drive out towards deep point. India happy to get de Kock off strike for the moment
tossed up, straight down the pitch, and he stretches forward to defend
presses forward to defend a ball shaping into him from outside off
length, and he goes back to defend this from the crease
tosses this up wider, into the foot marks, and it turns sharply, but he leaves
wide of off, sharp turn back in, and he lifts his pad and nudges it away with his pad, through to Saha

just like Elgar, de Kock brings up 100 with a six! Floated outside off, and he gets down on one knee, stretching forward, and blitzes this over extra cover with a superb lofted shot. The dressing room rises as one to greet this terrific innings from de Kock
pushed through a bit quicker, and he hangs back and pulls out a delicate late cut! Tantalisingly close to first slip, but all along the ground. Superb
ooh, sharp turn! Ashwin responds with a sharp turning ball just around a good length outside off, and it spins and bounces away as de Kock shapes to defend. Beats the outside edge
presses forward to defend a length ball
presses forward to smother a length ball outside off
defends a length ball
presses forward to defend
length, defended from outside off from the crease
sharp turn back in, and he is beaten as it goes in and strikes him on the pads in front of leg stump. The turn was taking it further down, though
goes back to defend a length ball
presses forward to defend
presses forward and drives a length ball around off
short ball, from around the wicket, and allows de Kock to hang back and play a rasping cut towards backward point. Pujara does well to run around from point and put in a slide to keep it down to two
wide of the crease, length, and he pushes forward to drive this wide of cover. Easy single on offer
length, angles into him, and he can play it away after a quick shuffle across, towards square leg
defends a length ball, angling back into him
drives a length ball outside off
defends a length ball, angling back into him
length, and he defends this
flighted, outside off, and he drives this wide of cover
flighted, and he drives this towards extra cover
tossed up, and he has hit this hard, and straight at Mayank Agarwal at silly point. Has to walk away for a bit, but seems to be okay
defends a length ball, tossed up around off
sharp turn from around off, moving further away as Muthusamy stretches to defend. Too good for the number eight, I dare say...
short of a length, just outside off, and he cuts this towards deep point
length, just outside off, and beats a waft from the batsman as he fishes from the crease
length, outside off, and keeps really low as it goes through to Saha. Muthusamy wants nothing to do with it
short, and he gets behind the line of this, just angling into him, to defend with a dead bat

angles this across from wide of the crease, and strikes him in front as it beats him for pace. Not given, and India have reviewed. There was a minor flutter, as the first point of debate was about whether it was a legal ball or not. Eventually, they roll on. No touch, and the line of it takes it way down the leg side. India lose their review as well

wide of the crease, angling in again, and strikes him on the pad again! Anguished cries from around the batsman, but they realise they might lose their second review too, and so decide against going for it this time
tossed up, slower through the air, and beats the outside edge as it turns away from off stump
almost a replica of the previous ball, but with slightly lesser turn. Beautiful seam, pointing towards first slip, as it beats him

the three-ball trick works for Ashwin! Started with one that turned sharp, the next one just a tad lesser, and this went on straight with the arm, and went through the gate as de Kock stretched to defend. Two balls that beat the outside edge, and this one crept right through to go on and castle him. Nevertheless, what a top innings this has been from de Kock. Taken a massive amount of pressure off South Africa!
goes straight on, pitching around off, and Philander stretches a bit to defend, but is beaten
defends this off a length just outside off
shorter, gets it to bite back from outside off, and Philander has to go back and defend this
flat ball, turning into him, and he plays from the crease
looks to catch him in the crease with a flat, turning ball, but he gets some bat on it
goes back to defend a length ball, darting into him
flighted further, and he drives this towards deep mid on
tossed up, and he drives. Hits silly point on the side. Vihari looks a bit winded from that! Took it flush on the left hand, actually, as he was turning. Might need some medical assistance
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
fuller ball, and raps him on the pads as he looks to defend. A bit of a cry for an appeal, but Ashwin indicates that this would have slid down leg
goes back to defend this towards square leg. Played from the crease again

tossed up, a bit wide, and Muthusamy uses his feet a touch to get this square. Ishant Sharma pulls off a half-stop at point, and then Ravindra Jadeja goes haring after this from cover point to keep the scoring down to three. Good shot, though
length, and he goes back and plays this towards square leg
goes back to defend this
length, and he hangs back in the crease to defend this
presses forward to defend a ball flighted around off and middle

oh, we have a grubber! Fires this across the batsman, and it goes along the ground. Misses the bat, the off stump, and also Saha's glove. Perhaps a touch of pad along the way, which encourages Jadeja to start off with an appeal
defends a length ball
drives a length ball straight down the wicket past wide mid off. They will pick up two before this is sent back by substitute fielder Shubman Gill
presses forward to defend a length ball
flatter, angles across him, and he hangs back and defends this
length, and he defends from the crease

what a beauty to pick up five! Floated around off, and Philander looks for the drive. It turns and spins back in through the gate, and just clips the top of middle and leg. Ashwin applauds...I think he likes how the ball is coming out today
length, and he gets behind the line of this ball directed at the stumps, and defends
tossed up, and this time he eschews the invitation to drive. Allows the ball to run off the outer part of the bat down towards third man, getting himself off the mark
presses forward to defend a ball tossed up outside off
tries out the leg-break, and he goes back and defends this towards midwicket
presses forward to meet a ball angling across him, and pushes it towards covers and gets a single
length ball, slants across him, beats the outside edge, and keeps low. Good take from Saha!
goes back and defends a length ball aimed at off and middle
tossed up, and he has a waft at it. Misses the ball, with a bit of turn on offer for Jadeja
short, and he goes back and cuts this towards point
fuller ball, on the pads, and he drives this back towards the bowler
flights this around off and middle, and he defends with a slight forward press
strays down the pads, and he looks to flick this. Gets a bit of his thigh pad, running down towards square leg
defends a length ball, and Muthusamy turns him down as he wants a quick single towards midwicket. The throw doesn't beat Maharaj, as he turns back, though
tossed up, doesn't turn much, as Maharaj looks to defend, and also keeps low, as it goes through Saha
comes forward to defend, but is beaten by the lack of turn on this
this time, he gets in on the bat. Hangs back in his crease to defend a length ball
floated up fuller, and he drives towards silly mid on
sharp turn, as he plays from the crease. Appeal for leg before, but surely, going down leg?
defends a length ball from the crease
oh, another one that bites the dust...as it creeps along. Muthusamy gets low down to defend this from the crease
defends a straight ball on a length
presses forward to defend this
length, and he hangs back and pokes this out towards cover. Happy to hand over to his spin-partner for the last five balls, if he can
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
length ball, closer to the stumps, and he presses forward to defend this
presses forward to defend a ball pitched around off and middle
outside off, and he drives this wide of cover. Wants a single, but Maharaj doesn't want to have to deal with it
length, and he presses forward to defend. And it's stumps on Day 3!
nips back in, and takes his pad along the way through to Saha. There's an appeal from the Indians, but Kohli indicates he doesn't want to take the review
length, angles back into him, and he defends from the crease
shorter, and he goes back to defend a ball jagging back into him
length, a bit wide outside off, and keeps low despite going at 139.8kph. Maharaj looks to swat it towards cover, but this sneaks under his bat
jaffa! Fuller, just outside off, and swinging away a touch. Maharaj has a tentative poke at it, and misses it by a fair distance as it goes through to Saha
length, outside off, and he defends this towards covers
fires this down the leg side. Muthusamy tries to swat it away, but misses out
presses forward and eases a ball fired in from around the wicket towards square leg
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
tosses it up, but it lands around leg and turns further down the leg side. Maharaj leaves
line still down the leg side. Maharaj presses forward, and gets an inside edge on to pad. It pops up, but just beyond the leg gully
presses forward to defend
length, outside off, and he is able to maneouvre this through the gully and point region for four, playing it from the crease
shorter, angles into him, and he defends
length, jagging back into him, and he defends from the crease
fuller, and it slants in. Maharaj gets an inside edge, and it runs away towards deep square leg
shorter in length, and he can hang back and steer this towards third man
a near celebrappeal there from Shami! Pitches on a good length just outside off, and then shapes away a touch. Just beats Maharaj's forward defensive through to Saha
defends from the crease
beats him with a good, turning ball. Tossed up a bit more, and getting him on to the front foot
similar ball, turns further away, as Muthusamy stretches and fails to meet the ball
pitched up further, and he plonks his bat down on time to get it towards point
fuller, wider, and he drives this towards extra cover
straighter, and Maharaj hangs back to defend this
fuller ball, angles in, and Muthusamy trusts the bounce and his judgement to let this one go. Not far from the top of off stump
length, jags back in, and he looks to cut this towards third man. Intercepted by the man at gully
length, angles in, and he stretches forward to defend
length, wider outside off, and he leaves
dug in short, and Muthusamy has to duck inside this. Bowled at a good pace, and forcing him to take evasive action as it was going towards his right shoulder
presses forward and pokes it away towards point
goes back to defend a ball going towards middle and leg
presses forward and drives through the off side past point
presses forward and is beaten by one that pitches outside off, but doesn't turn back in

Ashwin gets a sixth! Tossed up a bit more, and outside off, and Maharaj looks to go towards long on. Mayank Agarwal was placed a few yards close in from the long on fence, and just had to take a few steps forward to his right, and had an easy catch to complete. Skewed in the hands as he went for that shot, Maharaj, and that ends his resistance. Just one wicket to go now for India
angles down towards the leg side, and he plays it away towards square leg
presses forward to defend
looks for a full ball, but strays down the pads a touch. Muthusamy tries to flick it away, but gets it off the thigh pad towards short fine leg
length, and he presses forward to defend to a ball pitched around off, angling back in
presses forward to defend a length ball around off stump
shorter, and he stays back and pushes this towards point
floats this up outside off, and Rabada shoulders arms to it

lazy elegance from Rabada! Full ball, slanting in towards middle and leg, and he just eases into a lofted drive. Kept short midwicket and mid on interested for a brief while, but was timed well enough to clear both easily. Also takes South Africa past 400!
presses forward and defends a length ball around off
goes back to a shorter ball, and works it away towards square leg
length, and he defends off the crease. Almost beaten by the turn
presses forward to defend
shorter in length, and he is able to steer it to the right of short third man. Easy single to get off strike
wide of the crease, and he eases this towards covers. Jadeja goes haring after it, but cannot prevent the single in any case
presses forward to smother the spin on one tossed up around off
presses forward to one that starts around leg stump
tries to bend low to play a cheeky paddle shot, but gets it all wrong. Fullish ball, that comes off the blade and pops back into his body
followed up with a gorgeous cover drive. Fuller, and he stretches to meet it perfectly, and get it through covers
outside off, and he pads it away. There's an appeal for lbw, but wasn't doing enough to threaten the stumps
defends a length ball around off stump
flighted outside off, and he drives this to the right of cover
pitched up, outside off, and he comes forward to meet it right under his nose
tossed up, wider, and he lays into it! Bludgeons this over covers
fires this wider, quicker. It goes in to the foot marks, and then keeps a tad low. Saha cannot collect it, and it goes through him, just kissing the bottom of his gloves, down to the third man fence
leaves one outside off
wide, into the footmarks again, and he looks to cut but misses out on contact

goes back to defend one. It strikes him on the pads, but the bounce on it probably would have taken it over the stumps. India review, though, after it was given not out. The replays reveal there's no edge, and it might have clipped the top of the stumps. Indeed, ball tracking suggests that this will be umpire's call
flighted, and he plays this with a half-press forward. Just off the edge, but along the ground towards second slip
defends off the front foot
tossed up, and he goes over mid on. Well struck! These are massive runs in the context of the game
SMASHED THIS ONE STRAIGHT BACK! Tossed up, and fuller, and he pulls out the straight drive to the right of Ashwin. Superb striking
presses forward, and gets an inside edge on to his foot
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
goes back and pats this away towards cover
leaves one outside off
fired wider, and he leaves it again. Jadeja is trying to fire these in quicker, into the footmarks, but there's no support from them yet
defended towards cover
presses forward to defend
digs it in short, angling in from around the wicket, and he ducks under this
angles in towards his pads, and he whips it off his pads towards long leg. Jadeja is the man who charges at the ball from backward square leg, and he picks up a single for it
defended outside off
defends a fuller ball around off stump
defends a fuller ball outside off
fuller, and he pulls out a gorgeous on drive straight back down the wicket. Beats a diving Hanuma Vihari at mid on
tossed up, and he half-presses forward to defend

goes back to one and tries to defend. Hits him on the pads, but not given out. India review this one. Ball pitches around middle and then goes further on, but it still goes on to strike the leg stump. India have that final wicket, and Rabada becomes Ashwin's seventh victim
length ball down leg side. Looks for the flick but that's past his bat
length ball just outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
length ball in at middle stump. Locks himself up with a stride across for a moment, but adjusts to open the face and defend into the off side
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
past the outside edge. Angles this into the corridor and takes it away off the pitch as he has a push at it
length on off stump, defended to extra cover's left
full on off stump, driven with the turn to short extra
length and sliding in at off stump. Defended close to the body
length on off stump, steps out and defends into the off side
length and pushed in at middle stump. Defended off the inside half on the front foot
swatted to the midwicket boundary. Dropped short outside off, doesn't even have to move too much because this is slow and sitting up nicely. Pulled firmly
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
past the edge again. Movement away in the corridor off the seam as he feels for it on the front foot
length ball curving in late at off stump. Defends very close to the front pad as he gets on the front foot
inside edge onto body. Length ball just outside off, chops away from the body and gets this into the turf
length and in the corridor. Solidly defended on the front foot
length and in at off stump, watchfully defended to mid-off on the front foot
length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
misfield at backward point. Short of a length outside off, opens the face and slices this to the fielder's left. He lunges down at it and ends up going over it
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended on the front foot off the inside of the bat
length on the pads, flicked to midwicket on the front foot
inside edge as he plants the front leg across off stump to an inswinger. Rolls into the leg side off the pad
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, chopped to backward point
full and just outside off, driven to short extra
length ball just outside off, pushed into the off side on the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length outside off, nice and slow. Gets forward and defends to slip off the outside half
length ball wide outside off, reaches out and chops to sweeper cover

appeal for stumping. Rohit stepped out to a short ball that skidded on low and was beaten on the under-edge. He was briefly off balance...but got the front half of his foot just behind the line as QDK took the bails off
length on off stump, defended on the front foot

aerial sweep over the square leg boundary. His sweeping has got progressively better in this Test. It's a good option because South Africa have rarely had a fielder at the boundary there for Maharaj. Length ball, under it, and sweet connection to clear the infield and then the boundary
length and just outside off, tapped into the covers
full and into the pads, front leg across the stumps as he flicks this to fine leg's left. First run against Philander after 20 balls
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
length and curving in at off stump. Big stride forward to defend this
overpitched on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
outside edge but safely wide of first slip. Length ball dipping at off stump and turning away as he gets forward
length outside off, defended into the off side
length on off stump, defended with the turn
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side with the angle

paddled down to fine leg. Length ball wide outside off, reaches out, takes his eyes off it, and also the bottom hand in the end - but it's worth the risk. Only two fielders on the leg side and both in front of the stumps
ripping, bouncing turn and he's caught the high part of the outside edge. Length ball again, at a superb pace. Nice and loopy, drawing him forward and away from his body. Taken easily at first slip
length on middle stump, defended off the inside edge on the front foot
short of a length outside outside off, chopped to backward point on the up
pushed into the leg side one-handed as he shapes to cut this and it comes back into him
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops that on the pad
length and in at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
length on middle stump, driven uppishly to mid-on
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to point off the back foot
length on off stump, defended off the outside half
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length ball just outside off, pushes away from the body off the back foot
length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, solidly defended into the leg side
length and turning away from off stump, defended into the covers
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
length on leg stump, whipped to long-on's right off the back foot
length ball tossed up outside off, left alone
length outside off, left alone
filthy ball slapped over the midwicket boundary. The second such offering to Rohit and he won't miss out on those. Dropped short outside off and he gets the front leg down and pulls ferociously
length and just outside off. Defended solidly on the front foot
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
length outside off, looks to poke into the covers, gets it to gully off the toe-end. His throw has Pujara hopping and the crowd amused
length in the corridor, solidly defended into the off side
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length on off stump, opens the face to run this to backward point's left

in the air as he swishes away form the body. Floats out to sweeper cover. That length ball jumps away from him and he follows with his hands and tries to check the shot. No one in that region, luckily for him
length ball outside off, left alone
goes through at shin height. Length ball into the rough outside off. Left alone but that just doesn't climb. Good gather by QDK
full and into leg stump, allows it to come on and neatly tucks it into the vacant fine leg region
length ball, moving back in a touch, and Rohit drops it dead at his feet
presses forward to push this towards covers
fuller, and he comes forward and drives to covers
length, outside off, and he drives to covers. This keeps a bit low, too!
launches into this one, pitched a bit closer to him, but gets more height than distance. It goes over mid off, but pulls up ahead of the long off fence
length, angles in, and he plays it defensively towards short midwicket
flighted around off, and he drives towards wide cover
length, jags back at him a bit, but Pujara plays it with soft hands. Goes low, to the left of short leg
advances a couple of steps down the track and drives to mid on
tosses this up around off stump, and Pujara glides it to the left of point
fired in flat, and towards off stump, and he plays a very flat and deft sweep, just past short leg. There's protection in the deep, though, at deep backward square
goes back to a shorter ball and punches it towards cover point
length, a bit of nip back in, but Pujara gets behind the line and defends watchfully
length, again a bit of late shape back in, and Pujara defends. Is there a hint of reverse swing here?
fuller length, and he comes forward to drive this towards cover
length, straight at the stumps, and he defends
fuller, straight, and he defends this by plonking his bat straight down on it. Driven back to the bowler, who picks it up in his follow-through
length, and jags back in a touch. Goes off a defensive blade towards the man at short leg, who had dropped a few paces back, and to his left
outside off, and just runs off the outside of the bat towards third man. May have been a deliberate shot, played with soft hands, to keep it low, and to the right of the lone slip
turns back in from a length, and he defends
flatter, straighter, and he defends from the crease. A bit of a yelp from the close-in catchers, but it was well down to the ground as it went towards short leg
defends a length ball, bowled outside off
teasing ball, tossed up outside off, and Rohit defends after stretching
length, and beats the outside edge! Takes off, and doesn't turn, as Rohit looks to defend. Picked up by de Kock on the hop
length, homing in on off stump, moving back in, and he defends
length, a bit of movement back in, and he defends this towards short midwicket
length, jagging back in again, and Pujara <del>smashes this away for six</del> drops it dead with a forward defensive
this one shapes away after pitching on a length. Pujara lets it pass
length, angles in, and he defends this to short midwicket
angles in from outside off, and he defends to short cover
fuller, straighter, and he tries to drive straight. Skewed away towards short midiwcket
SIX OF THE BEST! Sashays down the pitch, and converts a good length ball into a half-volley, and goes over long off. Gets a lot of elevation and distance
pulls out the paddle sweep! Taken from outside off, and just uses the pace of a fuller ball to get it down to fine leg
fuller, straighter, and he plays it towards short midwicket
presses forward to defend a ball, slightly shorter, outside off stump
length, outside off, and he goes back to punch it back towards the bowler
defends a length ball around off stump
defends a length ball, slanting in towards his leg stump
length ball, and he defends this towards silly mid on
length, and he blocks this towards short midwicket

and there it is! Fuller, but strays on to the pads, and Pujara whips this away with his wrists. Keshav Maharaj chases it down from square leg, but makes a mess of pulling it back. Gets his right hand to it, but the momentum of the ball takes it over the ropes
length, shapes away, and Pujara leaves
a bit of bounce as it turns into Rohit, and it comes off his glove. Just where short leg might have been, but they get a single to square leg instead
uses his feet to get to a length ball around off, and whips it towards midwicket
uses his feet again, but cannot place his whipped shot anywhere around short midwicket

oh, beautifully bowled! One that pitches around off, and goes on with the angle, and Pujara's got a bit of bat on that, but de Kock cannot get to it. Deserved a reward for that, but this would be classified as a drop!
defends a length ball around off stump
uses his feet to skip down the track, but again can only play it with the spin towards short midwicket
turn and bounce for the first ball, going across Rohit and beating a forward defensive prod
presses forward to defend one around off stump
tries to flog one from outside off, on bent knee, but that sneaks under the bat
length, but he hangs back and guides this past slip towards the third man fence. Delicate!
outside off, turning further away from a good length, and he leaves
flighted close to him and he defends

sharp chance that is dropped at short leg! Pujara skips down to a length ball around off, and whips it low to the left of Markram, who moves with the shot. It strikes him on the left leg, before he can get a hand to it
defends this towards short midwicket
advances and defends the ball towards cover
hangs back and defends a sharply turning ball coming in from a length
flicks away a fuller ball towards midwicket
drops this off a good length at his feet
presses forward to defend a length ball around middle
sweeps towards long leg, fetching it from outside off
defends a length ball angling across him from just outside off
defends a length bal around off
angles across him, from a good length, around off, and he leaves
fuller, straighter, and he defends
fuller, straighter, and he defends this
length, and he pokes it towards cover point. Rohit wants a single, but Pujara refuses. Earns a rebuke from the striker
length, and he nurdles this towards square leg, and Pujara is very quick to respond this time
length, outside off, and he skips down the wicket, but can only drive uppishly towards mid on
presses forward to defend a length ball around off
presses forward, and meets a length ball with his pads
full on middle stump, pushed down the pitch
short of a length on off stump, hurriedly punched to extra cover off the back foot
length and lobbed up outside off. Thinks of the drive, leaves as it turns away
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
that shoots up from the pitch and even the keeper has to dive to his right to try and catch this. That was headed to slip after beating Rohit who had stepped down. Run out chance, if anything...
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
length on leg stump, clipped to deep backward square
short of a length and flat at off stump. Punched to short midwicket

missed stumping. Tossed up on off stump, Pujara steps out and looks to whip this through the leg side. He's beaten and so is QDK. Poor Piedt - could have had Pujara thrice today. This Test doesn't get any better for him. Seems there was a tiny edge on that too

oh lovely shot! Typical Pujara. Length ball outside off, steps out and makes it to the pitch this time and uses the spin to flick this fine of midwicket and into the square leg boundary. He's been looking for that shot for a while
length on leg stump, steps out and offers the pad after being beaten in flight
short outside off, pulled hurriedly to midwicket
and fifty. Length on middle stump, steps out and drives along the floor to long-on and raises the bat

oh yeah. Glorious drive wide of mid-on. It's so good to see when this comes off for Pujara. Length on middle stump, quickly down the pitch and the angled bat to comfortably beat the fielder to his right
short of a length just outside off, chopped into the covers

stunning. Just stunning. He's used his feet and got boundaries off identical balls in three different areas in the last six balls or so. This is length on off, he jumps to the pitch of it and drives with the turn to mid-off's left. All along the floor
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length and turning into off stump. Looks to dab this past slip, gets it into the pitch off the sticker
length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
length outside off, steps out and flicks to mdidwicket
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket with the turn
length outside off, well forward to defend on the front foot
full outside off, pushed down the pitch on the front foot
length on off stump, defended into the leg side
down to the long leg boundary. Full ball drifted in at leg stump, Pujara steps out and turns it into a full toss. 'No, no, no,' says QDK before Pujara even gets to that. Clips it to the boundary
and now he cashes in on the overcompensation from the bowler - dropped short outside off. Backs away and punches it behind point
and another. But deep point is in. Short and flat outside off, makes room and cuts firmly
turns it past the edge. Drifted in outside off, draws him forward and gets big bounce too
inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick from the crease. Length ball on middle
length on middle stump, steps out and jams it to midwicket
length and in at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, steps out and flicks to midwicket's right
length on off stump, defended on the front foot

close at long-on Muthusamy lunges to his right, catches the ball and ends up stepping on the boundary padding as he tries to lob it back in for himself to take on the second attempt. Piedt was overjoyed, and so were a his team-mates. The fielder himself wasn't too sure. Length ball on middle stump, Rohit stepped out and drilled it flat to his right and couldn't quite get the elevation. But he survives. Piedt is still wicketless after four chances
past the edge. Short of a length and pushed through quickly outside off. Beaten on the attempted late cut
length ball swung way late in the corridor. Left alone
full and shaping away in the corridor, left alone
full and angled into off stump. Solidly defended down the pitch
length outside off, defended as this swings in
gets it past backward point. He was getting some swing, but this one is dropped short. And wide enough for the cut. He gets it point's left
length and into leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, steps out and is forced to defend
tossed up full and wide outside off, chopped out to deep point
length outside off, steps out and offers the pad
length outside off, steps out and blocks into the off side

slapped over the midwicket boundary. This is what he does to spinners. Jumps out often and forces them to drop their lengths. This is turning in from outside off, he gets deep in the crease and pulls it into the stands
length outside off, steps out and clips it neatly to midwicket's right with the turn
short of a length and rising into the body. Cramped and he just fends this into the leg side, one-handed
length and just outside off, defended into the off side
toe-end as this length ball outside off stays low. He looked to drive that on the up. That swung back in too
past the outside edge. Length ball curving away outside off. Looks to dab it down to third man, but that's rapidly away from him
length outside off, opens the face and runs it to deep point
length on leg stump, flicked with the angle down to fine leg
short of a length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and turns this to short fine
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside half
length outside off, defended off the inside half
short of a length just outside off, pushed to extra cover's left with the turn
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and late swing away outside off. Stabs it to backward point's right
length on middle stump, defended to leg side off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, defended into the off side
length on off stump, defended into the covers

big appeal as this clips the back thigh and QDK takes a diving take down leg side. Superb delivery. Got it to jump back in from a length outside off. Beat the inside edge by a long way. No bat on that. No review
length and in at middle stump, defended into the leg side
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, chopped to short third man's left
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
full on off stump, defended into the leg side
full and into the pads, steps out and clips to backward square's left
length on off stump, defended to short third
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
short ball up in the corridor, dips into the leg side to let that go

crunched into the covers boundary to bring up his fifty. Complete different player now from the one at the start of the innings. Full and just outside off, leans into that and gets it between backward point and cover
length outside off, drops it to point's right with soft hands
full outside off, pushed into the off side
attempted inswinger is a full toss on the pads. He clips it out to deep square
expertly done. Length ball pushed through flat outside off. Gets low for the paddle and executes it perfectly to get this fine
full and drifted into leg stump. Driven to long-on
