tossed up outside off, left alone as it turns away
short of a length on off stump, onto the back foot and punches it back to the bowler
length on leg stump, angled in. Glanced to short fine
he'll keep doing it. Length ball on middle stump, steps out and gently pushes this to midwicket's right with soft hands
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot

outside edge between keeper and wide slip! Length ball straightens in the corridor as he pokes at this awa from the body. The edge dies on QDK as he chucks his right hand at this. Rabada has set it up for that edge in this spell, he's disappointed
length and curving into the corridor. Nudged to backward point off the under-edge

between keeper and wide slip again! This one would have carried to a conventional first slip. QDK diving again for one he won't get to. Length outside off, jabs at it inside the line. Keeper and bowler exchange smiles
length and in at off stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
length ball just outside off, defended to cover on the front foot
length on off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
full outside off, left alone
off the shoulder of the bat as this length ball gets big on him. Was forward to defend at that
lifted over midwicket. Short of a length ball skids into middle stump. Gets back and has to hurry at this as it cramps him. Manages it nicely
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
length outside off, spins away. Watchfully defended on the front foot
length ball just outside off, defended to cover on the front foot
length on leg stump, looks to flick, deflected to square leg off the pad
length outside off, looks to drive through the line but that swings in late and comes off the inside part of the bat. Tumbling stop by mid-off to his left
oh that's jumped up and hit him in the chest and then his bicep. Length ball outside off, gets forward to defend and that jumps at him
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs this to backward point
full and down leg side. Looks to whip that but it keeps tailing away. QDK won't get a hand on that
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length and turning away from middle stump. Defended off the thick outside edge
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tickled fine. Length ball doesn't turn from middle stump. Pujara uses the angle, gets forward and gets it into the vacant region
length outside off, steps out and pushes to midwicket
short outside off, cut to deep point
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball swung away outside off, left alone
length ball shaping away outside off. Left alone
beats the edge. Lovely bowling. Goes wide of the crease, angles it in and then gets it to cut away. Taken on the bounce by QDK
caressed through point. Wide of the crease again, but this is full and despite swinging away, he can reach out and open the face late to find the boundary
length outside off, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and chops this past backward point
and now to his left. Short outside off, allows it to come on and dabs it late between slip and backward point
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to long-on's right
length on off stump, defended into the off side
full on leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
length on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
nicely driven but stopped by mid-on. Full ball at the stumps, full face offered as he drives past the stumps
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended into the off side
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, steps out and bat-pads it down the pitch
length outside off, steps out and defends into the leg side
length outside off, steps out and drives to midwicket
short of a length and spinning down leg side. Too far for the keeper to get a hand on that

appeal for lbw as he steps out and bat-pads another. And they review again. That definitely hit the pad in front of off and was low enough to hit the stumps. But they had one similar decision stay on umpire's call because the batsman was three metres down from the stumps...it was pad first this time. Impact is deemed umpire's call though outside off. So they'll keep the review and he'll survive
length ball, darts in, and he defends this from the crease
length, a bit of away movement, but Rohit covers it beautifully as he drives through the extra cover region
length, and pops up a bit. Pujara plays it well as it slants in, taking one hand off to steer it towards square leg
fuller, and he presses forward and defends
length, wide of off stump, moving further away, and Pujara lets it pass through to de Kock
fuller, outside off, and he defends this under his nose
short, and he puts this away towards deep midwicket
outside off, and he runs it towards point
straighter ball, and he plays this towards midwicket
short, and he goes back and goes well over midwicket. Two short balls this over, and both have been punished by India!
length, a bit of extra bounce, and he defends this from the crease. Pitched just outside off, turning back into him
uses his feet to chip down to the line of this, and flicks it away towards midwicket
fuller ball, outside off, swinging further away, and he plays a fluent extra cover drive. Bavuma goes chasing this from cover and saves a couple of runs
fuller, straighter, and he plays a gorgeous straight drive, but cannot pierce the gap to the left of mid on
length, towards the pads, and he tries to flick this away but cannot get any bat on it. Goes on to hit the inside of his left thigh, and drops away behind de Kock, to his left
length, shapes into him, and he gets behind this to defend this straight back down the wicket
steers a length ball outside off towards third man

traps him in front! Given out leg before, but Pujara has referred this. Fair delivery, and goes straight on, as Pujara shapes to defend. Misses the outside edge, and then strikes him below the thigh pad on his back leg. As dead as it can get, and India lose a review with that. Fine bowling from Philander
length, outside leg from over the wicket, and he defends
tires the reverse sweep, doesn't nail it, but is able to get it off his glove towards point. Jadeja responds quickly to his call for a single, and then makes it through with ridiculous ease
length, spins a bit and jumps on Jadeja, who presses forward to defend
fuller, and he drives, but cannot get it past the bowler
tossed up outside off, and he swings this one over cow corner! Not perfect in terms of how well he middled it, but got a lot of power behind that! No intent to keep it down
tries a reverse paddle, but doesn't make contact. Full ball, outside off. Clever variation from Muthusamy
oh, gorgeous! Hangs back and gets on top of a slightly short and wide ball, and then just punches it through cover point
down the leg side, and he tries to flick this. Almost over-balances, but then does well to keep his back leg in, as de Kock collects and shapes to whip the bails off
outside off, and he looks to steer this towards third man. Goes off the toe of the bat, and runs past slip. He's asking for a replacement now. Kept a bit low too
strays down the pads, and he glances this away. They settle for one, and want Rohit to get strike on 99!
on the pads, and he gets it away towards square leg. Acknowledges the applause for another ton! Asked to open the innings for this Test, and he's done it in characteristic easy fashion

full ball, and he looks to press forward and defend. Philander reckons this was pad first. Not given, but South Africa have reviewed this. Front foot is fine, and the ball does duck back in from the line of off stump. It's difficult to make sure the ball hit pad first, though, which might go in Jadeja's favour. It's close, nonetheless. The TV umpire thinks this is pad first. It does most things right, but the ball misses off stump. So South Africa lose their review!
length, outside off, turning back in, and he defends
lap sweep, played from outside the off stump and way down to fine leg. What a shot from Rohit!
fuller, and he heaves this down towards long on
angles into Jadeja from around the wicket, and he pokes it towards point
wide and short, but keeps low. Beats Rohit's under edge as he looks to swat it away
defends a length ball around off
length, outside off, and he draws back and punches this towards point. Wants two, but has to settle for one
looks to sweep, and the turn beats him. Strikes him on the right underarm, but with the bounce, there's no risk of being lbw
keeps low as it comes in from a length on the stumps. He goes back to keep this out
length, outside off, and again takes the inside of the bat! Nutmegs de Kock, but a deflection off his pads takes the sting off the ball. Just a single, as slip goes across to short fine leg to field
full ball, and he looks to swat it away and gets a bit of pad on it down towards fine leg
length, and he hangs back and plays this away towards point
length, angles into him, and he plays this away towards midwicket
full, from around the wicket, and strikes Jadeja on the pads as he looks to flick. May have gotten an inside edge on this
floated around off stump, and he biffs this down towards long off
that's no. 11 for the match! That was not too full, but he stretches, and muscles this over long on. Well struck
and he equals Wasim Akram's 12 sixes in a match! Flat six, over midwicket, to a ball that was outside off

it's raining sixes in Vizag! Saves the best for last, chipping down the wicket, and smashing a flatter ball outside off, yet again over long off. That's seven for this innings, and 13 for the match, a new record for both Rohit Sharma and India. Most sixes in a match
outside off, and he goes past point towards the backward point fence. It is pulled back just in time
Maharaj fires this outside off, and he shuffles across to defend
goes for a sweep, but goes off the outer edge and skews in the air. Lands safely between deep square leg and long leg
fired in at the stumps, and he works it towards midwicket

he's stumped for the second time in the game! Over 300 runs in Rohit Sharma's first Test as opener, and it ends as he comes down the track to a well-flighted ball from Maharaj. Good bowling, as he finds himself not quite to the pitch of the ball when looking for a lofted shot, and de Kock does the rest. Almost a replay of the first innings, with some rapturous applause from the crowd, and the acknowledgement from the South African team too
presses forward to punch a length ball outside off towards cover. Half-stop, which enables a single to be punched
fuller, and he drives this towards long on
tossed up around middle and leg, and he drives it back towards the bowler
length, and he hangs back and flicks this towards deep square leg. Quick call for two, and they make it comfortably
length, and goes on with the arm. He goes back to cut this, and gets an under edge, on to the ground and pops up towards slip
driven down the ground towards long on
length, and he goes back to flick this towards midwicket
flat, towards leg stump, and he flicks this away. Gets it to race past the man at 45 degrees, and it goes towards deep backward square leg
length, straightens into him, and he defends
charges down the wicket, and seeing that Maharaj drops it shorter and wider. Jadeja has to adjust to steer this, standing upright, towards point
length, and he goes back and presses this towards cover. Quick running fetches them one
fuller, wider, and he drives this down to long off

wide, outside off, and he throws his bat at it with a flourish of the wrists, and goes right through cover! Struck with some ferocity, and even though substitute Klaasen got some part of his fingertips on to it, it sped away for four
full ball, and he digs it back towards the bowler
tossed up, and he goes back to drive this, but ends up playing it back towards the bowler
slogs a ball tossed up around middle and leg, gets it away towards deep backward square leg
length, and he plays this from the crease
fuller, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
length, and comes back into him, and he defends from the crease
length and turning into leg stump. Whipped to short fine's left off the back foot
length on off stump, half a stride to drive firmly with the turn to long-off's left
creamed over midwicket with a slog sweep! Wow those were some fast hands. Length ball outside off and the decision to sweep came quite late. Superb wrists
more of those hands. Full and wide outside off, reaches out for that and slaps it with a horizontal bat to sweeper's right
short of a length outside off, chopped to short third man
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the back foot
straight and flat. This is fired full and fast at middle stump. Just gets the front leg out of the way and drills it straight
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left
full and in at middle stump, flicked off the toe-end through midwicket and an early call to come back for two as deep square runs in
this is very high but he's got it well behind the long-on boundary. Full and into middle stump. A big, clean slog at this. Gets a little under it, but powerful enough
short outside off, cut to deep point
length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on
full on off stump, flicked to midwicket
full and wide outside off. Looks for the cover boundary with a loft, but slices off the toe-end to sweeper
length on leg stump. Looks for the flick, gets it to the keeper off his pad
smashes off stump. Length at off stump, looks to slog across the line and completely misses that. Sweet sound as this splits middle and off stump
big inswinger raps him on the front pad. That hooped back in after starting on off stump and hit him in front of leg
leading edge is short of long-off, who seems to have lost the ball in the background. Moved very late. Length ball on leg stump, looked to whip that through midwicket but closed the face too early
short of a length on leg stump, punched to deep square off the back foot
stylish to get off the mark. Length on off stump, uses the turn and lofts that to long-off's left
oh smart. Rahane gets six runs off two balls with no risk. This is tossed up outside off, gets forward and down at it, then laps it to the fine leg boundary
off the spine of the bat! Tossed up full outside off, gets down and reverse-paddles this past slip without bothering to get the face of the bat at this
low full toss on middle stump, flicked to mid-on's right

through slip. Full ball outside off, jams the bat down at it as it swings away late from middle stump. Sensational ball actually. Thick outside edge rolls to Faf's left at slip and he can't get down in time
beaten. Short of a length and climbing wide outside off. Looks to slap this over the covers but that's gotten too big
short and down leg side. Looks for the pull, can't get to that. Big diving take from QDK
sneaks through from under the keeper. Length ball angled in and straightening. Draws the outside edge once again. It rolls through to the keeper who barely makes an attempt to get low at that
length on off stump, opens the face and runs it to backward point
short of a length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
short of a length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
oh lovely. Length ball in the roughage outside leg stump. He steps out, gets to the pitch and lifts it inside-out over the wide long-off boundary. Superb skill
length on middle and turning away. Looks for the reverse sweep and is beaten
full on middle stump, looks for the reverse, gets a bat-pad into the covers
short of a length on middle stump, backs away and pushes into the off side
length on middle stump, backs away and punches to extra cover
length ball and curving away from outside off. Looks for the late cut, beaten
short and down leg side. Cramped on the attempted pull. That goes down leg
yorker at middle stump, jammed to mid-on

rises steeply and has QDK leaping up to stop that. Short ball outside off, looks for the hook but that flies by. It looks like he was taking his eyes off that as well - the visibility is not good - to get out of harm's way
short of a length and into the body. Opens the face and runs it into the gully region
slapped in front of deep square with a hook and with that, they will declare. Short ball outside off, quickly behind the line and fast hands to get the hands over this
length on middle stump, pushed past short leg off the back foot
length outside off, tapped into the covers on the up
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, driven on the rise to short extra

sounds like that's hit the low part of off stump after going past his attempted drive. Length ball stays low and skids on as he pushes away from the body. It's hit Saha's boot, but there was a woody sound for sure
short of a length on off stump, onto the back foot to punch to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length and turning into the thigh. Deflected to short fine as he looks to flick
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length and angled into middle stump. Defended down the pitch
tossed up outside off, driven with the toe-end to mid-off
tossed up a little wider outside off, reaches out and drives to backward point
length outside off, punched to cover on the up
full outside off, flicks to long-on with the angle
length on middle stump, punched to midwicket off the back foot
length outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
length ball turning down from leg stump. Beaten on the flick
length on leg stump, defended into the square leg area

huge appeal and then they review with two second left on the clock. That's kept low at a middle stump line. My first thought was leading edge, but that has gone under the bat and hit him at shin height as he's looked to flick off the front foot...he's bowling around the wicket. Did that pitch in line? Yes it did! Skidding onto hit middle stump. Jadeja was raucous and violent with that appeal but it took a long time for Kohli to be convinced of the review, probably because he is around the wicket. But they've made the decision that's got South Africa's most solid batsman from the first innings
short of a length at off stump, defended from deep in the crease
length ball skidding in rapidly from middle stump. Hurriedly nudged to backward square's left off the back foot
short of a length on off stump, punched to silly mid-off on the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length on middle, defended into the leg side
full and flat outside off, leans in meets it on the full to drill through the covers
full on off stump, defended on front foot
full on middle stump, defended into the leg side
length outside off, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
beaten. Short of a length and marginal turn away in the corridor. Looks to cut that
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended into the off side
length and skidding away from middle. Defended off the outside half of the bat
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length on off stump, rising up at middle stump. Dead-batted off the inside half
length on off stump, skidding onto the bat as he gets forward to defend
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and into leg stump. Whipped uppishly to mid-on's right off the back foot
full on off stump, defended off the inside half
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, goes deep in the crease to defend into the leg side
full on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
length ball wide outside off, watchfully defended into the off side
length outside off, dead-batted down the pitch
length outside off, defended into the off side
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length, a touch wide, and he punches this off the back foot wide of point
short of a length, straying down leg, and he lets this pass

uppish, off the outside edge, and runs away to the third man fence. Length ball, just a bit of nip away, and he pushes at it standing from the crease, and gets a leading edge, but it goes way wide of second slip
length, nips back in and he defends this towards cover point
defends a length ball angling into him
shapes back in, and he plays this away towards mid-wicket
goes back and defends a length ball turning back into him
flights this outside off, and he presses forward and gets the leading edge, but it goes past first slip off Saha's right pad. Could be considered a half-chance
eases this towards point
goes back to defend a length ball

WICKET NUMBER 350 FOR ASHWIN! Tosses this up wide of off, and gives some supreme revs on this one. De Bruyn shapes to cut this away, but finds the ball dipping late on him. He's committed to the stroke, though, and ends up playing it off the inside edge on to his stumps. Ashwin lets out a celebratory roar - he now joins Muttiah Muralitharan as the only men to have reached 350 Test wickets in just their 66th Test. Take a bow!
half-press forward to smother a length ball around off and middle
presses forward and defends a length ball shaping back into him
length, and he presses this towards point

GONE RIGHT THROUGH HIM! This pitch is playing some tricks now, though this was well directed from Shami. A length ball, and keeps quite low, and Bavuma tries to adjust, but cannot bring his bat down on time. Goes right through him, and he topples over as he loses his balance. South Africa are unravelling now. They need a hero or two
fuller ball, on the pads, and he whips it away towards square leg
short, well-directed as it chases du Plessis, who does well to weave out of the way, stretching to his left, and keeping his gloves down
throws this up wider, and he has a swish at it, but misses
flights this outside off, Markram stretches to defend, but it goes on with the arm and beats the outside edge comfortably
fired closer to Markram, who presses forward to defend
wide of the crease, slants into him, defends this towards short midwicket
flighted, straighter, and he brings his bat down straight to defend
presses forward and defends a length ball tossed up outside off
wide of the crease, outside off, and he lets it pass
length, outside off, with a hint of movement away, and he leaves
shorter, moves away from him, and he lets it pass
length, nips away a touch, and he defends this towards point
length, keeps low! The line was outside off, and du Plessis tries to play from the crease. Would have been in trouble had that been straighter. A bit of a lottery with the variable bounce now
wide of the crease, and slants it down the pads, and all he has to do is get some bat on it. Does so with a wristy flourish, sending it speeding away to the fine leg fence
length, and he presses forward to meet it right in front of off stump
DISMISSIVE! Flights this outside off, and he skips down the wicket, a little to his right to get closer to the pitch of the ball, and then swings this high, wide and handsome over wide long on

off the glove, but safe! This turns sharply, and bounces from a length, and he shapes to play a defensive push. Takes his bottom hand off, and the ball skews off his gloves, but beyond forward short leg
defends a length ball
defends a ball outside off
goes back to defend one turning in from a length from outside off
presses forward to drive a length ball towards short cover
fuller ball, outside off, and he leaves
length, and he presses forward to defend this
length, outside off, moving further away, and he leaves
outside off, a bit fuller, and keeps low again. Du Plessis just watches it through
outside off, and shapes further away, and he leaves
length, outside off, and beats the outside edge as du Plessis looks to defend from the crease
defends a length ball
goes back to punch a ball down towards deep mid on
presses forward to defend one
sweeps from outside off, rolling his wrists to keep it low, as there's protection in the deep for Ashwin for that shot
goes back and flicks a length ball towards deep square leg
goes back and defends a length ball, darted in towards his off stump
length, outside off, and he presses forward to defend. The ball goes off the outer part of the bat, but along the ground, to point
length, a bit of shape back in, and Markram leaves
length, a bit of shape back in, and he defends pressing forward
seams into him from around off stump, and he plays this with the tide towards mid-wicket
length, and he presses forward to defend
full, but on the pads, and he can just whip this away towards mid-wicket
rears off a length from outside off, and the batsman has enough time to adjust and defend this
presses forward to meet a length ball, tossed up around off
presses forward to smother one around off
flighted, outside off, and it's full enough to enable him to drive. Gets it low, and to the left of silly point. Well placed, through the covers
presses forward to defend one outside off
fuller, and he comes forward to meet it nearly on the full, eventually driving with the inward turn towards long on
length, angles in, and Markram defends from the crease
oh, good ball! Angles in, and then seams away as Markram shapes to defend
way down the leg side, and Markram cannot lay any bat on that. Saha does well to dive away to his left and collects with both hands

length, and keeps low! Takes the outside edge as Markram looks to defend, and then runs away between the second and fourth slip, through to the unprotected third man region. Runs for the batsman, but some more lifting of the spirit for the fielding side
strays down the pads again, and this time Markram plays a slightly miscued version of a flick. Toe-ends it away towards long leg, but takes a couple of bounces through to the fielder
length, and dies on its way to Saha from outside off. He gathers with some difficulty
presses forward and neatly defends a ball pitching around middle and off
stretches forward to defend a ball around middle and leg
wide of the crease, slants into him, and he presses forward to defend
outside off, and he leaves this once he sees it turning away from him
length, and he goes back and punches this towards a short cover in place
tossed up, and a lot more turn! Beats the outside edge as Markram stretches to defend, and Saha collects
length, and he defends from the crease, pressing forward slightly
length, outside off, and he lets this pass
length, shaping in, and he presses forward to defend this right under his nose
length, but allows enough room for him to stand tall and punch this past mid off. Placed exquisitely to his left, but crucially, the bounce was true on this occasion

OH, HE'S DONE HIM IN! Faf du Plessis has been leaving a number of balls around off and just outside, and that's where this ball from Shami starts. There's a sharp movement back in after pitching, though, and it comes shooting right back and takes off-stump with it. Du Plessis can only look in disbelief, and then begins to drag himself off the square. Shami goes off in celebration, arms spread wide open. India can probably begin to get their first sights of the final leg of this effort
fuller on the stumps, de Kock goes for a flick but misses. An appeal for lbw but was clearly heading down
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
too full this time, Markram frees his arms and lofts it over mid-on for four
uses his feet this time and lofts it over mid-on once again, dribbles towards the boundary
length ball on the stumps, pushing the batsman back, turned away towards the leg side
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, covers his stumps and lets it go through, some extra bounce there for Jadeja

bowled through the gate. De Kock was caught at the crease to a length ball around off, looks to push tentatively, hoping it will go across him but the ball straightens after pitching and crashes into the off stump
short of length outside off, sways away from it
length ball around off, once again holding its line, Muthusamy defends it down the ground from the front foot
fuller on the stumps, going for the yorker but just missing his mark. Muthusamy pushes it towards mid-on
short of length around off, angling in towards the batsman, taps it towards short midwicket
length ball in the corridor, pushes at it and gets beaten
length ball outside off, not much room but short of enough to rock back and cut it behind point for four
a touch fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
short of length once again, Markram goes for another cut but straight to the backward point fielder this time, he's not happy with himself
short of length outside off, punches it towards deep extra cover this time
fuller around off and middle, pushed towards mid-on where the fielder is a tad deep
length ball on the stumps, goes deep and defends with a straight bat
length ball around off, keeps low once again but Muthusamy manages to get his bat on it
length ball angling in towards middle and leg, defended from the crease
length ball on the stumps once more, defended in a similar manner again
length ball outside off, Muthusamy plays with soft hands, opens the face of the ball and it runs past the gully fielder
length ball on the pads, looks to defend but gets a thick outside edge towards the off side
length ball around off, defended solidly down the ground

a brilliant caught-and-bowled. That's Markram, a big wicket. Is the end nigh? Was fuller on the stumps, Markram looked to go over the top once again, got it from the middle of the bat as well but couldn't get the required elevation. Jadeja hops in his follow through and snaffles it with his left hand
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and blocks
a touch shorter this time, stays back and blocks again

fuller on the stumps, Philander was looking to flick it away, misses and an appeal for lbw. Mind you, first slip caught the ball but did it pitch within the line of the stumps? India want to review this. Pitching around middle and leg, no bat involved and hit the batsman on the back pad in front of off. Would have gone on to hit the off stump. Three reds and that's a pair for Philander

almost an action replay of the last ball. Length ball on the stumps, spinning away to beat the bat and hits the back leg. Up goes the finger but Maharaj wants to review this. Once again no bat involved, hitting the back leg around off and middle and it's umpire's call on the stumps, would have clipped the off stick. So the original decision stays. Jadeja on a hat-trick
and it's a harmless looking length ball outside off that Piedt defends safely from the crease
fuller on the stumps, paddles it fine but Jadeja keeps it to one
length ball around off, pushes it towards extra cover to get off the mark

length ball outside off, some turn there, comes forward and defends
a touch shorter and wider, looked slower as well, waits for it before pushing it towards point
length ball around off, defended on the off side
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it towards short midwicket

length ball around off and middle and spinning in, looks to defend on the front foot but misses, another appeal for lbw but this was perhaps missing leg

slog-swept for a six this time, fuller around off and Piedt makes a neat connection to send it over deep square leg, this is now the most sixes in a Test match

presses forward, and the ball doesn't turn as he anticipates. Runs off the inside of the bat towards square leg
